campaign.story:
He is Camriddeon. The Torn Soul. He is the savior of Dannisfire. Overthrew a tyrant.  Married a princess. Established peace throughout the realm.
He is the despot. Who killed a king. Bent the land to his rule, and watched it fall to ruin.
He is a hero. A villain. Lover, liar, mage, demon. Depends who you ask.
Hello everyone! We are so excited to launch our Legends of the Realm series with Camriddeon, the Torn Soul. A new epic fantasy series in a world of magic, demons, true love, and the questions that tear at the heart.
This 50 page tale follows the life of Dannisfire's enigmatic mage. The Torn Soul is a hero, a tyrant, a lover, a traitor. He toppled a kingdom, established greatness, and watched it all fall to ruin in fire and ice. Was he good? It depends on who you ask.

What is in Legends of the Realm?
A 50 page epic fantasy, launching the Legends of the Realm series.
Special Edition includes Legend of the Realm's first short story "Camriddeon and the Leighman Lurkers." +8 pages of content!
2 amazing prints from artist Evan Scale
Variant cover from legendary artist Tony Moy
And more!

Evan Scale's Website
Instagram
John Robinson website 
Micah Myers website

Praise for Legends of the Realm
Camriddeon reminds me of the great fantasy adventure novels of my youth. There's a great reverence to fantasy-pulp past, but also with an eye to the future.
- Russell Nohelty, Wannabe Press Creator of "Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter."
"This story is a blast, and it holds so much promise for an expanded world of fun, magic, and adventure.  Make it happen!"
- Greg Wright, Creator of "Monstrous."
“As short stories go, CAMRIDDEON AND THE LEIGHMAN LURKERS has everything you need. Great fantasy. Dynamic art. And a character that intrigues as well as captivates. I look forward to more adventures in this interesting world.”
- Frank Martin, writer of "The Polar Paradox," and "The Last Homicide."
"Cammrideon and the Leighman Lurkers is fantasy at its finest. Jack Holder writes it from an interesting narrative perspective that makes the story seem both familiar and new, and Evan Scale’s art is pitch-perfect, epic and poignant at the right moments. It is one of my favorite stories in the Creator Connections, Panel 1 anthology"
- A. A. Rubin, Comic Book School.



Why Start with the Torn Soul? 
Legends of the Realm is, in essence, about people and legacies. With new history, and changing dynamics in the world, we are reevaluating how we see figures like Founding Founders, Dr. King, and even our own ancestors' role in history. I've personally struggled with how to look up to figures, as we can now see the flaws so much more clearly.
And I spent a lot of my college and grad school years with my foot firmly planted in my mouth, wrestling with this in ways that made others uncomfortable. And so I turned to a man that, for a while, lived only in the back of my mind. A good man, certainly. But angry, passionate. Human. Trying to change a world the only ways he knows how.
Camriddeon is my attempt at bringing forth a high fantasy that looks at the mage from all sides. We have seen the warrior hero, striving against evil, just as we've seen compromised schemers, lovers, and those who do bad things for good reasons. What happens when the greatest hero the realm has ever seen, had his story told by others? Would he be the hero? The villain? Or simply a man?
Why Kickstarter?
This will be my ninth Kickstarter project, and quite possibly the one that I've given most of myself towards. The Legends of the Realm team is coming here because this platform, and you the kickstarter community, is one of the best audiences we have ever seen. 
With Legends of the Realm, this series is a wonderfully huge undertaking that I and the rest of the team cannot wait to bring to life. 
What will the funds be used for?
Making comics is a rewarding, if difficult venture. Putting together a 50-page comic is  one of the biggest individual efforts we've ever done as a team. Funds will be utilized to make this comic, and the upcoming series that follows a reality. 
Check out a free preview of Torn Soul below!

What kind of rewards can I get?
Back at this level because you believe in our work. Every spark can help make a fire blaze, and we are so thankful you are a part of our campaign.
You want to make sure you get this comic as quickly as possible, and prefer digital. With this reward you receive: 
The 50-page comic in digital format.
 Sometimes, it just feels better to have the book in your hands. Back at the Apprentic level to receive:
The 50-page comic in physical format.
 - And Legends of the Realm: Torn Soul PDF! - 
 Want to know more about the world of Legends of the Realm? This Special edition brings tons of added content, including an 8-page short story and a peek behind-the-scenes!
 - And Legends of the Realm: Torn Soul PDF! - 
Our best value! Our special edition comic with variant cover from Tony Moy!
 - And all previous rewards! -
 What is the best part of Legends of the Realm for you? The art, of course. You want to get more and more of Evan Scale's amazing work. And with the Journeyman of Scales, you will also receive 2 prints by our artist Evan Scale!
 - And all previous rewards! - 
 Want to start a Legends of the Realm group? Get friends and family involved in this series by getting five copies of our comic!
- And Legends of the Realm: Torn Soul PDF! - 
You don't just want Evan's work. You want something that is all your own, a brand new commission from artist Evan Scale! And we have limited commission spots with our artist available for you! But make sure you grab it before it's gone. There's only 3 left!!!
 - And all previous rewards! -
 Don't just back Legends of the Realm; become a part of the story. Back this reward to receive a cameo in Legends of the Realm: Torn Soul. Headshot will be required.
 - As well as the following rewards! - 
Kickstarter has a new add-on feature that allows you to select additional items after you have chosen a reward tier.
If you want more books from Arcane Inkdustries, you can check out the add-on comics below!
 The Following Casework: #INeedaMiracle
A rogue god has arisen out of Twitter. Armed with a hashtag that grants miracles, and a list of followers not afraid to use it, Titus and Bev are faced with a world where the internet dictates reality.
             They must travel to the temple of Twitter and face the new god's high priests. At least the coffeeshop has lattes...
 Dealing with the Apocalypse
Welcome to the end of the world. Don't worry. Step on in to a new world. A world filled with magic, possibilities and wonders. A girl that finds more than her desires in the caves. A boy who tells a story better than he ever did as a man. We will look up at the stars in delight. And the stars will look down and wish they were here. From the world of Arcane Inkdustries, Dealing with the Apocalypse is the first collection of the stories in this quirky dystopia of magic.
 Demon Riders
There is evil in this world. Demons, rampaging beasts…Texans… For many in the world, there is only one hope to turn to. Harsk and his Riders, ruthless warriors against the encroaching darkness of the Pit. Defending the weak, destroyers of demons, and broken beyond any hope of repair. But the Ride is changing. One day of recruiting will turn the Ride on its head, and many will never be the same again. All because of one poor child. Kait Demonborn is a Rider. Evil will never be prepared.
Born of Magic
Ever felt like school just didn't want you to succeed? That your dad wishes were that you would just go away? You've been trapped in a clay jar for a thousand years, and wondering if anyone might help you out?
That last one might be peculiar for the Scourge of Darrenfell. Born of Magic follows the lives of four groups of adventurers. Students, friends, daughters and heroes, all living in a world that is increasingly more fantastic. To survive, they will take on dragons, old gods, a lightning ghost, and the Fairy King who remembers them all too well.
Each is called a fool. An idealist. A blight upon the world.
Just don't call them kids. 
Why Faith?
Have you ever wondered about why you have faith? Or wanted to know more about what that part of your life could mean?
             "Why Faith?" is a wondrous, full-color comics anthology, jam-packed with stories from creators of all faiths, identities, and backgrounds. Edited by Jack Holder, and featuring some of the greatest creators in the business, these 30 stories bring to bear the question of why one should (or should not) have faith, and how it truly changes the very nature of life.
So what's the Plan?
After funding we hope to build the book and special edition throughout the summer.
We hope to print the books over August, and start shipping in September
And with your efforts, start the next arc of Legends of the Realm
Thank you all so much for reading. Legends of the Realm is supported and made possible through your efforts. Jack, Evan, John, and Micah all send our heartfelt thanks to your support.
Make sure to back our project, share the campaign, and help make this new series a reality!

updates.update_content:
Hello dear backer.
We wanted to let you know how the production is going. Evan is inking the final few pages. What is so different about Torn Soul is that not just the story, but the style changes between the three narrators. The second tale, told by the princess, celebrates the romantic elements of the high fantasy genre.

Congratulations!
Wow! Thank you all so very much. 121 backers raising over $8700. This is an amazing accomplishment, and myself and the entire Legends of the Realm team are so honored with this trust and faith in this comic.
Evan and I did a countdown video celebrating you, talking about what comes next, and the creation process. you can check it out here.
What is coming next? Well, we are going to be creating the book! In fact, here's a sneak preview of page 4, right now!

updates.update_userinfo: More awesome kickstarters to check out!
updates.update_content:
Hey there, dear backer!
As we hit the end of this campaign, I did want to let you know about a few other campaigns that are going on that you should totally check out. 
Pocus Hocus is the story of a Victorian-era magician named - you guessed it - Pocus Hocus, who sells his soul to a demon in exchange for actual magic powers. Years later, he comes to regret his decision, and sets out to reclaim his soul.

This is it, everyone! The last day!
This has been as immensely rewarding as it has been nerve wracking.  We’ve gone so much farther than any other campaign I’ve held before, and in the pursuit of some of the best fantasy I’ve ever written. Thank you for helping make that a reality.
Make sure you have as many add-ons as you would like. All of my prose books, editor John Robinson’s Scorpio series, and the extended flash fiction lore are available!

Hello backers!
We are so close to the end! There is just a 48 more hours until the end of the campaign, and we funded yesterday!
Thank you so much for all your posting, promotion, and absolutely phenomenal support. If you haven’t yet added a twist to a daily backer bonus flash fiction, make sure you do so and have a ton of fun with it!

WOW!
Wait, that's not the best way to describe the exclamations in an epic fantasy. Let me try again.

Hi there,
We've only got a few days left! The campaign has been going absolutely wonderfully, and I cannot thank you for how far we've already come. Here is what you've already unlocked in milestone rewards!

Hi there!
There's only 5 days left to back Legends of the Realm! And we've just started to make some new add-ons!
I wanted to let you know how the Flash Fiction is going for our daily backer bonus. Here is a quote from our first day, Chivalry.

campaign.story:
Red, White & Broke: Confessions of an American Superhero is a humorous look at the side of superheroes you never see:  the financial side. 
Meet Robert Rhodes, better known as Captain Stronghold, one of America's most well-loved superheroes. He's super-strong, he can fly, and he's adored by millions. He's also FLAT BROKE. Busted. Bankrupt. Being a superhero is surprisingly expensive and it's hard to keep a job when you keep disappearing for hours at a time to save people's lives. 

So Captain Stronghold goes on national television to reveal his secret identity and to turn to the people he's saved countless times for help... financial help! Yes, the world's most beloved superhero is launching a crowdfunding campaign to fund his super heroics!  After all, those costumes don't just pay for themselves!
Red, White & Broke is a superhero story that's not a superhero story. It's a look at the (literal) cost of being superhero, all told in the wryly comic writing style of #1 bestselling author and award-winning podcast host Mike Spring. Along with rising comic art star Dennis Tirona, Mike has crafted a 24-page debut issue that dives deeper into the logistics of being a superhero than you've ever seen before. Who makes the costumes? Who pays for them? How many jobs can one superhero hold? Are secret identities worth it? All these questions and more will be answered in Red, White & Broke: Confessions of an American Superhero #1!
Variant Cover by Ian Chase Nichols (The Tick, TMNT)
Variant Cover by Drew Moss
We've got a great selection of rewards for backing this project, including three different covers to choose from. You can pick the regular cover by series artist Dennis Tirona, or choose from two different variant covers by Drew Moss (Vampirella/Red Sonja, The Crow, Image's Copperhead) and Ian Chase Nichols (The Tick, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Batman/TMNT). Or collect all three! In addition, there are art prints of all the covers as well and a special bonus art print at select pledge tiers! There are also truly exciting original art reward tiers for the art collectors out there!
An interior page from RW&B #1
Even better, THE BOOK IS ALMOST 100% COMPLETE ALREADY!!! It is written, penciled and inked, and the first four pages have been colored! All three c overs are  penciled, inked, and colored (there is some lettering to be added to the newspaper on Drew Moss's variant cover)! This Kickstarter is basically to fund the last three phases of production: Coloring on the remaining 20 pages, Lettering, and Printing!
Below you will find the full breakdown of rewards. We have three levels of rewards: Regular Rewards (comics, art prints, variant covers); Limited Rewards (Original Art Pages, Sketches & Ultra-Limited B&W Variants); and One-of-a-Kind Rewards (Original Art by Drew Moss)! Keep scrolling to see them all!
STRETCH GOALS!

More than just a trading card, this wallet-friendly card is made of sturdy plastic and shows that you officially backed Captain Stronghold's campaign and helped fund his superheroics! Better than a trading card and only available through the Kickstarter campaign!

Plus notes and commentary by Mike Spring!

LIMITED REWARD TIERS - 
Here's a closer look at some of the exclusive limited rewards we're offering:
Ultra Limited Black & White Covers ($40 each) -

It's still a great looking page, but with no main characters featured prominently, we wanted to offer it at a discount. There is only one page like this available! First come first served!  ADD ONS - 
We've tried really hard to create a variety of reward tiers that offer something for everyone. However, if you can't find exactly what you're looking for, you can do an add on! Simply over-pledge buy the amount the item you want costs, then email us at emailoutload@verizon.net and tell us what item you're adding on. 
For example, let's say you wanted to get the three regular cover package ($25) but you also wanted an Ultra Limited B&W cover ($40). All you have to do is select the three cover package but adjust your pledge to $65. Then email us and let us know you want the B&W cover as well, and we'll make sure you get everything you pledged on!
 ABOUT THE CREATORS -
Mike Spring (Writer) - Mike Spring is the Amazon #1 bestselling author of the Bloodsucker Blues series, a four-book humorous vampire novel story. He is also a pop culture reviewer and three-time award-winning podcast host. You can find his writing at popular film website LiveForFilm.com and he is a regular fixture at many major ComicCons. As the creator and co-host of the create-your-own-movie-sequel podcast After the Ending, Mike has gained a whole new audience of fans. As a comic book reader and collector for over 30 years, Mike is excited to finally bring his story of Red, White & Broke to the world of comics!
Dennis Tirona (Artist) - Dennis Tirona is a freelance comic book artist from San Pedro City, Laguna, in the Philippines. Only drawing professionally since 2015, Dennis has already amassed an impressive body of acclaimed artwork. In addition to several comic book short stories, Dennis art has been featured in the hit comics The Ferryman and The Nefarious Smyths. Dennis describes his artwork as: "I was not really interested in doing pin-up or poster art, so I studied on how to draw sequential pages. Gave myself a few months to learn as much as I can, made some sample pages then got my first sequential gig in October that year and it’s been freelance work ever since. I always aim for a clear page as I want the story to be seamless, and my art style is definitely on the cleaner side and not too anatomically exaggerated, although I am also developing a style more keen on the noir look."
Drew Moss (Variant Cover Artist) - Drew Moss is an Illustrator based out of southeastern Virginia and has worked for Dynamite (Red Sonja/Vampirella), IDW (The Colonized, The Crow, MASK) Dark Horse (Creepy), Oni Press (Terrible Lizard, Blood Feud) Image Comics (Copperhead) and various other publishers. Drew enjoys fine cigars and whiskies and spends too much time writing bios.
Ian Chase Nichols (Variant Cover Artist) - Ian Chase Nichols a comic book artist and graphic designer. He's worked on books like The Tick (NEC), Batman/TMNT (DC/IDW), Ninja Turtles (IDW), Elvira (Dynamite), and a whole slew of other books and projects. He's also worked in graphic design for over ten years, working on everything from logos and branding to websites, and has been the lead designer on some award-winning books that have sold tens of thousands of copies. 
Thyago Brandao (Colorist) - Thyago Brandao is 29 years old and lives in Brazil. He has a degree in Analysis and Systems development, but has always been passionate about digital painting, comic books, manga and the like. Now he is extremely busy as a comic book colorist. He has been working as a colorist since 2016, with work in the Doctor Who comics, as well as tests for DC, Marvel, IDW and Dynamite and he has recently been working for French publisher Soleil.
WHEN WILL I GET MY REWARDS?
Honestly, the book is almost complete, as we mentioned above. We're estimating about a month after the Kickstarter ends to get the coloring done, another two weeks for lettering, and then it's off to the printers! But that's where the uncertainty comes in. With the Coronavirus and postal delays, we're hesitant to put an exact date on it, but we want to get this book into your hands ASAP! We'd like to say you'll have them in December, but with the delays mentioned above, we're projecting January just to be safe, but are very hopeful you'll have them before that! All comics and rewards will ship together, as we already have ALL the art rewards in hand!
LOOKS AWESOME! CAN WE SEE MORE?
Sure you can! Here are a few more pages from the book, both colored and uncolored!

updates.update_content:
Hi all!
Just a quick note to remind Issue 1 backers that there are just two days left on the Issue 2 campaign! You’ve still got time to pledge on digital and physical issues, original artwork, and much more! It would really be a huge help if we could get most or all of the people who pledged on Issue 1 to return for Issue 2. And don’t forget, we’ve already unlocked two free audio commentaries for issues 1 and 2 that are going to be a lot of fun! These are free for ALL backers of Iissue 2!
Here’s the link: tinyurl.com/RWBissue2

Great news, everyone! We just hit 200 backers! That means two free audio commentaries have been unlocked and will go to EVERY backer, whether digital or physical! I’m really excited to do these; I have lots of fun tidbits and anecdotes to share about each issue, and with years of podcasting experience under my belt, I’m confident I can make them fun and interesting.
If you’re an Issue 1 backer who hasn’t yet pledged on issue 2, you’ve still got nine days to get on board! We’re only $800 away from hitting our first stretch goal of FREE METAL BOOKMARKS for every physical backer! It’ll take some doing, but I think we can get there. Remember, the more you share the campaign and spread the word, the better the chance of getting free extra goodies!

updates.update_userinfo: Come Check Out Issue 2! Plus A New Interview & More!
updates.update_content:
Hi all!
This update is going out to backers of the first Red, White & Broke Kickstarter. We’re still about 40 backers down from the first campaign, which is normal with Kickstarters, but with two weeks left in the campaign, I wanted to send a friendly reminder to Issue 1 backers that Issue 2 is now live! We are fully funded and are working on some exciting stretch goals! Remember, if we get to 200 backers (we only need about 20 more), it will unlock two free audio commentaries for EVERY backer! You’ll get to hear the stories behind each issue, learn about the technique of how we created the books, and learn some interesting trivia tidbits as well!

Hi, everyone!
Things are moving along nicely on the Issue 2 campaign, although now that we’re almost a week in, we’ve reached the point where things have slowed down considerably. We’re at $3200, which is good, but we still have $1300 to go to reach our goal.
So I’ve decided to add a digital backer goal, inspired by my fellow creator Steve Bryant (who makes the very cool Athena Voltaire comic!) and these new rewards will go out to ALL backers! If/when we hit 200 Backers, that will unlock two free audio commentaries! What are audio commentaries for comic books? Well if you’ve ever watched an audio commentary on a DVD or Blu-ray for a movie you love, it’s like that… but for comics. I will go page-by-page through each issue and talk about my creative inspiration, share interesting trivia, and tell cool stories about making the comics! (And don’t worry, I’ve been a podcaster for years, so these will be fun and lively, not boring and monotone!)

campaign.story:
Welcome to our latest Flesk Kickstarter campaign! We are offering three new books! The first is the latest art book by Mark Schultz, Carbon 4. The second book, Xenozoic by Mark Schultz, is a handy to hold and affordably priced new printing of his classic Xenozoic Tales comic series. The third book focuses purely on the legendary Al Williamson, titled Strange World Adventures! Plus, we have four premium prints on offer: one by Williamson, and three by Schultz. Please read the details below for more  information. Thank you for visiting!
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #1! Book binding upgrades! Please see the stretch goal section below for details.
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #2! Bonus Sketcbook! Please see the stretch goal section below for details.
Carbon 4 is the latest collection that highlights Mark Schultz’s favorite recent and past works. From the barbaric past to the nightmarish future—from the ocean’s depths to the farthest planets—Carbon 4 features Mark Schultz’s most-ambitious works to date!
Mark Schultz unleashed! Inspired by the otherworldly pulp stories of his childhood in the 1950s and ‘60s, Schultz continues to draw inspiration from the adventure, fantasy and science-fiction genres of that imaginative period. With its visions of romanticized space exploration, this time continues to be a primary influence on his artwork and in this new collection, where the focus is on life on other worlds.
Commissions, personal works and archival art can all be found within the pages of Carbon 4!
While many of these new visions were created purely for his own satisfaction, Carbon 4 also features Schultz’s most recent commissions and commercial illustrations. As always, Xenozoic’s Jack and Hannah are featured prominently. A number of the works include preliminary sketches as well as the finished pencils, residing alongside their completed brush-and-ink companions. Two gatefolds highlight a pair of the artist’s most-ambitious commissions to date—illustrations of contrasting literary interpretations of Martian life.
Two gatefolds showcase new works by Schultz!
Carbon 4 also opens the Schultz archives to highlight obscure pieces not included in his previous volumes from Flesk. Rarely seen imagery from the first decade of his career is finally revealed after years of requests from fans. The drawings include covers done for the SubHuman series as well as for Superman, Aliens and Predator. Also presented are sketchbook page samples that offer insight into the artist’s thought process. As a bonus, fans will find “Time Troubling,” a little-known three-page teaching aid made for a long out-of-print book about how to tell a story through comics. The breadth and scope of Schultz’s evolution as an illustrator is fully represented by these dynamic images spanning his thirty-year career.
Carbon 4 book interior artwork reproduced from the originals!
A stunning first collection in a new series showcasing the career of legendary artist Al Williamson.
This first compendium in a new series is the perfect introduction to Al Williamson’s work. You will find samples that span his fifty-year career along with anecdotes and historical details salted throughout. Cover art, interior pages, drawings and sketches—plus photographs of Al and his friends posing as reference for his sequential art—are included. This volume contains a mixture of both his most-obscure and best-known works, all meticulously reproduced from the original art.
Until now, this captivating original artwork has only been seen by those fortunate enough to visit the Williamson studio in person. For the first time, readers will be able to view the artist’s most-cherished works. Williamson’s love of 1920s and 1930s adventure, fantasy and science-fiction pop culture—and his admiration of artists such as Flash Gordon creator Alex Raymond—grounded his drawing technique and storytelling, which evolved throughout his life. He was able to take these inspirations and carry on the legacy of the past masters while becoming a unique icon in the industry. In this collection, readers will be able to witness Williamson’s development as an artist.
Artwork from the originals revealed from the Al Williamson studio.
Comic pages and covers from Al Williamson's fifty year career are showcased.
This 352-page Xenozoic book is a handy-to-hold collection of all the classic Xenozoic Tales comic stories written and drawn by Mark Schultz. This is a new printing with a new cover. Welcome to the Xenozoic Age, a post-apocalyptic landscape where dinosaurs are the lords of the Earth…and humanity is the endangered species!
“What a strange new world, to have such creatures in it!”
Forced into hiding by a global ecological cataclysm, humans emerge from their underground warrens half a millennium later to discover that the Earth has been totally transformed. All of the familiar flora and fauna are gone, replaced by a radically altered natural order populated by rampaging dinosaurs and strange new creatures. It takes guts, grim determination, ingenuity and a whole lot of old-fashioned luck just to survive, much less thrive, in this alien wilderness—all qualities that ace mechanic Jack Tenrec, lovely scientist Hannah Dundee and their friends possess in abundance.
A new collection of the classic comic series by Mark Schultz!
But even the worthiest of these hardy souls are hard-pressed to surmount the obstacles presented by their new homeland. And when those trials are further compounded by the underhanded and selfish actions of the cutthroat human scavengers they encounter, even the best-equipped and bravest among them might not endure.
Xenozoic artwork reproduced direct from the originals!

Xenozoic combines lush and richly realized ink-and-brush artwork with a pulp-fueled narrative to create an action-packed fantasy—an unrelenting adventure that also serves as a subtle cautionary fable concerning the unforeseen consequences that shortsighted present-day decisions might have upon future generations.
Sequential sample pages from the Xenozoic story.
These four signed 13 x 19" museum quality giclée prints feature three recent artworks by Mark Schultz, and one classic piece by Al Williamson that has been colored by Steven Roberson. These prints utilize 290 gsm acid free matte paper that is  water resistant and they are printed with archival and fade resistant inks.
The limited edition prints on offer are "Dark Portal," "Epic," and "Tigress of the Southern Seas" by Mark Schultz. The Schultz prints come signed and numbered. The Al Williamson print "Lair of the Golden Princess" comes numbered. If you pledge for 1 or 2 Mark Schultz prints, you can provide us with your choices when we send out the Kickstarter surveys.
Please note that the books and the prints ship separately. 
We will include an 8 x 6" mini-print with all book pledges of $25 or more, one different mini-print for  each of the three books. A total of three bonus prints if you get all three books!
All Kickstarter stretch goal and bonus items are limited to one per backer.
Stretch goals are a way for us to offer an additional thank you as the campaign grows. Thanks to our supporters we have been fortunate enough to hit our initial goal on day one. We are pleased to announce our first stretch goal.
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #1! Book binding upgrades!
We will add 4" french flaps to all three paperback books. Plus, we will add an upgraded custom ordered material to use for the  quarter-binding on the hardcover Al Williamson and Xenozoic books. For the Carbon 4 hardcover we had already budgeted for the Arlin boards with a blind stamp under a dustjacket to match volumes 1-3. Please see update #1 for more details and sample pictures.
As an art book publisher, I am someone who is always eager to add  improvements to the book binding along with upgraded material that is  not typically found on books in the stores. A good thing about the  Kickstarter platform is that your support allows us the confidence to  add these features that could not be done otherwise. We hope to hit this  stretch goal so that we can research and implement these book  construction upgrades. The art of the book is just as important as the art that is found within the pages. --John
Stretch Goal #2—Bonus 16-page Sketchbook! UNLOCKED!
We will include a free 16-page, 5.5 x 8.5-inch paperbound saddle-stitched sketchbook collection titled The Al Williamson and Mark Schultz Astounding Sketchbook with all book pledges of $25 or more! This will feature previously unseen blue pencil drawings from Schultz’s personal sketchbooks, and also sketches and preliminaries by Al Williamson. Both Williamson and Schultz will have 8 pages worth of material each. This bonus item is for those who make a book pledge of $25 or more and is limited to one per backer.
Add-on anything to anything! An Add-On lets you pledge for more than one tier by adding the price of any additional tier to your existing pledge. Say you want to include an extra hardcover signed book? Or maybe combine a few tiers or make your own selections? Please contact us through Kickstarter and we can provide you with a grand total that includes the shipping. If you have any questions we are here to help.
We expect to have your pledges shipped to you in February 2021. It takes approximately three and a half months for everything to be printed and then to be delivered to us. We will ship them to everyone immediately upon their arrival at our Flesk warehouse in Santa Cruz, CA.
Here is a detailed schedule and outline so that you know what to expect.
August 2020: Finalize the designs of the three books. Mark Schultz completes a few new pieces to include in his Carbon 4 book.
September 2020: Finish the book designs and package the books for the printer. 
October 1, 2020: Turn in the books to the printer. Review the proofs and approve the book for the press.
November 2020: Make the premium prints, the Kickstarter bonus items. 
January 2021: Receive the books from the printer. Begin shipping them to our supporters.
February 2021: Packages begin to arrive at your homes.
All books are shipped within the U.S.A. by USPS Mail and will include tracking. Premium signed prints shipped in the U.S.A. will ship  by USPS First Class mail (small prints) or Priority Mail (larger prints or packages with multiple prints) and will include tracking.
The items shipped to our international friends usually take 3 weeks for delivery to your local post office, but can sometimes take up to 3-6 weeks depending on the country. Note that customs for your local country may hold on to packages for a  week or longer and incur  additional charges that is the responsibility of the backer. We will not  mark items as a "gift." We know that shipping overseas is  very expensive and we wish it was cheaper, too! We help by subsidizing  some of the shipping cost. We make no money from the shipping charges collected.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John Fleskes answers:

I pride myself on having an 18 year record of publishing nearly 100 art books. I've run over a dozen previous Kickstarter campaigns with artists such as Brom, Frank Cho, J.A.W. Cooper, Jeffrey Alan Love, Gary Gianni and Mike Mignola (Hellboy: Into the Silent Sea Studio Edition), Petar Meseldzija, Richard and Wendy Pini (Elfquest), Mark Schultz, and Daren Bader and Lance HaunRogue. Most of these have been on time. We are very open with our backers and communicate through updates often to keep you up to date.

In some cases, things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published nearly 100 books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands when I said I would.

Thanks to everyone has supported us. You directly help us to make these beautiful books.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NEW REWARDS ADDITIONS BELOW!
 Presenting the new and exciting Jetta Raye Adventures, appropriate for all ages, featuring the 22nd Century exploits of teenage Jetta and her friends Arky, Hilaria, Biff, and Gizmo, as they explore strange new worlds, encounter aliens, dinosaurs, future alternate timelines, and the most challenging adventure of all-High School!
The characters were created by Ned Pines and designed by Dan DeCarlo in 1952, as a response to the popularity of Archie Comics. There were three issues originally published, but the book was soon overshadowed by a larger market presence by Archie and a flood of titles by comics publishers like EC. The title was unceremoniously cancelled and quietly slipped into public domain.
Over the years, reprint books have showcased these classic stories, but this is the first time ever that an entire book of all-new adventures will be published!
The idea for a collection of new Jetta adventures had been kicking around for a few years by Rich Maurizio.  We talked years ago and last year he approached me again to say Jeff Shultz and Ken Wheaton were also up for it.  We talked and here we are.  We immediately went to work recruiting some really special friends and talent to make the original vision a reality!
"Fishing Cover" by Jeff Shultz and Jimmy "T" Tournas
Here are just a few samples of stories from the book...
Page from "COOKIES" story by Craig Boldman/ Jeff Shultz and Tim Estilez
Page from "Star Truckers" story by Chris Yambar / Pat & Tim Kenndey / Jim Tournas
"Shake your Bot-ty" story by Angelo DeCesare / Bill Walko
"The Binge" a Simpson's parody by Craig Boldman / Jeff Shultz / Ken Wheaton.
My first Kickstarter was a handsome hardcover book in 2014 for Joe Sinnott, collecting his Pope John XXIII stories from Treasure Chest comics, which Joe personally considered his best and most personal work.

      My Credits are Inking Spider-man Sundays, Archie and Friends, Inking & Producing Shylock, Monster Squad and Full Moon Craze six book Mini-series.
Rich has worked on books and comics for many popular characters over the years, like Animaniacs, Looney Tunes, and The Munsters.
Jeff has drawn many characters, but mainly hundreds and hundreds of pages for Archie Comics over the last few decades.
Ken has worked on art for several Simpsons books and comics, as well as drawing issues of Popeye.
Joining these guys is an all-star team… writers Chris Yambar, Matt Manning, Angelo DeCesare, Craig Boldman, and Paul Kupperburg, along with artists Joe Sinnott, Al Milgrom, Pat & Tim Kennedy, Bill Walko, George Broderick, and Tim Estiloz.
Joe Sinnott penciled and inked one of our covers, As well as inking Jeff Shultz on a cover,  sadly these will be his last original published work.  With his passing, Joe didn’t get to pencil a story for the book, so Al Milgrom graciously stepped in to draw a story that would have made Joe proud!
Joltin' Joe Sinnott putting final finishes off Jetta cover
Rounding out our team, we’ve got hand lettering by the talented Eddy Chapman, digital lettering by Mattia Gentili, colors by Michael Woods, and some inked images by Mark Sinnott, in a book with his father-what a wonderful tribute!
Mark Sinnott inking Jetta Raye Strips
Rich Maurizio, Jimmy T (Me) and Joe SInnott 2019 at Saugerties, NY
Archie Artist Jeff Shultz
Archie and Jetta artists Pat and Tim Kennedy
Writer/Artist Cris Yambar and Artist George Broderick
Artist/Inker Bill Walko
Joe Jusko, Ken Wheaton and Joe Sinnott
Team assembled and working hard to bring you the best in entertainment.
Pat and Tim Kennedy pencils, Jimmy T inks.
As a reward we have a Joe Sinnott inked cover over Jeff Shultz. 
"Dance Cover" by Jeff SHultz and Joe Sinnott
We also have as a reward Joe Sinnott's last comic art cover he penciled and Inked.  It is currently being colored and lettered. 
Joe Sinnott holding his Jetta Raye Adventures "Space girl" cover.
Finally we have a chance to own a  Signed Joe Sinnott Original Art Spider-man page. Only one left.   They make great home or office framed conversation pieces.  Or a gift perhaps.
 UPDATE!  I have added two more Spider-man Pages to this.  See Images.
February 2000 Original art Spider-man Sunday Signed by creators.
2011 Spider-man with the Living Vampire!
2002 Spider-man with Blue fly, Mary Jane, Aunt May and Peter Parker!




 I was asked if I had anyhing else signed by Joe for a reward so I am adding these two books.
Signed Journey into Mystery By Joe Sinnott
The rear of signed Journey into Mystery #95 by Joe Sinnott
Signed Journey into Mystery #96 by Joe Sinnott
Rear of Signed Journey into Mystery #96 by Joe Sinnott
This book was a labor of love, and we’re really proud of the result. We hope you’ll enjoy reading it as much as we enjoyed making it!
Please help spread the word as well.  Thank you for reading this and wishes for a healthy happy summer!

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS! FOR ALL BACKERS WITH PHYSICALLY SHIPPING REWARDS!
After that comes our NEXT STRETCH GOAL REWARD - THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN #300 HOMAGE SHI: WOTW #1 25TH ANNIVERSARY PURE LINE VARIANT COVER! 
SHI’S BACK! Exclusive cover by Billy Tucci
BLACK FRIDAY SPECIAL - REMARKED NOIR PRINT!
Kickstarter Exclusive Cover - SHI: Return of the Warrior!!!!!!!
There I was… 
Armed with a portfolio holding the very pages in this book and storming the floor of the 1993 Comic Con International in San Diego…
I was anxious.  I knew no one, but even though my heart was pounding through my chest at this “one shot” at comic book fame, I held a strong conviction that I could somehow scratch out a living in this fantastically creative industry.  Like many a budding cartoonist at this biggest of all conventions, I stood in long lines and when it was my turn to show my wares, opened my book hoping the bored and hung-over editor would awake from his stupor and look up at me wide-eyed like he’d just made a great discovery…  And offer me a job. 
STRETCH GOALS!!!
  (Please note: Stretch goals are distributed per backer)
Problem was, that aside from Lady Death creator, Brian Pulido (who graciously offered me a pin up), no one was interested.  From the “Big Two” all the way down to the smallest of publishers, all turned me down -- every single one of them.  To say I was heartbroken would be a callous understatement, but I was undeterred.  I remember thinking to myself, on that long flight back home to New York, about a life of illustrating licensing products, or even going back to designing children’s wear.  Perhaps I could go back to the National Guard.   Either way, I had to do something as I was incredibly broke and way behind in my rent.
I put on my Sony “discman” (remember those?) and removed the portfolio from the aircraft’s overheadstorage bin.  Listening to Kitaro’s Kojiki, (which was the soundtrack I crafted up the “Way of the Warrior” story arc) I began thumbing through the book, critiquing each and every panel and determining which pages were good and which had to be redone.  My mindset was one of defiance as my train of thought was  “I’m not going to forget these pages and come back in six months with new material” like I had been instructed by the editors.  I will keep them, improve upon them and move forward with “my story”… the story of Ana Ishikawa and her monogatari titled, “Shi.”  I was going to self-publish comic books.
Billy Tucci - Creator
And that, pretty much, is how it all started.  Of course the next six months were utterly painful, but so exciting, as I delved into researching - just how in the hell does one “self-publish?”  This was before the internet, so I hit every library, read every book and bothered every retailer who would speak to me, trying to figure out just how to do this.  All the while, I worked freelance design by day and sharpened the Shi pages by night.   I “employed” two great friends, co-writer Peter Gutierrez and designer Barry Orkin, with my ever-suffering wife (then ever-suffering girlfriend), Deborah to refine the script and define the artwork.  There was much aggravation, missteps, late hours and fear – at one point I almost sold half the creation to a pair of predatory business “partners”, but that’s a story for a different day.  There were also triumphs -- none so gratifying as March 23, 1994 – the day, “Shi – The Way of the Warrior #1” shipped to comic shops across North America and Europe, making the anxious drama that seemed to daunt its creation every step of the way all well worth it.
As they say, from that day forward, things have never been the same.  And it’s all because of my friends, family, retailers and most of all, you – the reader.  Especially those of you who, for some reason or another, chose my book among hundreds that day in 1994, and for that I am forever grateful.  
SHI: Way of the Warrior #1, 1994
So join us for the first new Shi graphic novel in 15 years  ...  A story in which a comic book character has grown up in real time. ..  A story that is literally 25 years in the making and one we hope you will love reading as much as we have loved making.
Thank you… #SHISBACK!
Billy Tucci

SHI’S BACK!!!!
SHI “Amazing Spider-Man #301” Homage Cover by Billy Tucci
Crusade Comics is so excited to bring you the debut crowdfunding campaign for our all new 48-page graphic novel Shi: Return of the Warrior! 
Nigen-Sei Cover by Billy Tucci
In this story over a quarter century in the making we now find our heroine Ana Ishikawa 15 years removed from when she last graced the pages of a comic book. Ana is divorced from her husband, disgraced NYPD detective Peter DeNyse and now lives a peaceful, quiet existence raising their teenage daughter Hotaru.
Teenager Hotaru Ishikawa and her mother, Ana
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
Most importantly, her warrior days far behind her…
But that all changes when Dr. YOU (a character that will be named after one of our backers via a special pledge level) brings the terrifying news that Masahiro Arashi has escaped from a New York City Mental Institution. Her former antagonist, now suffering from dementia has regressed back to his younger more violent self and is vengefully obsessed with the one person responsible for his incarcerated existence… Ana Ishikawa!
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior page
Manhattan is once again gripped in fear as a series of gruesome copycat Shi Killings resurface – with the order of victims proving ever closer to Ana. A desperate Ana must now, alongside Dr. You, seek out and stop Arashi before he can fulfill his murderous destiny… a destiny whose road ends with her own daughter Hotaru.
The maddened Masahiro Arashi
As Doctor You and Ana get ever closer, he confesses to her of Arashi’s twisted and dangerous obsession with the young Ana’s secret warrior persona, SHI, the living embodiment of death.
Worse still, the maddened Arashi is convinced that everyone: nurses, orderlies, janitors and especially the man treating him is in love with the lithe mistress of the underworld (Yomi). 
Dr. "You" (to be named by one of our backers!)
Ana is mortified that the doctor is fully aware that she is indeed a murderess and knows that if ever exposed would rightly be the end of her world. But You assures her secret is safe and even though his own life is in danger, he promises to take it (due to both professional and personal reasons) “to the grave.”
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
But the grave just might be waiting for them all. For Ana will realize that measured acumen only goes so far in protecting those you love and, once again, the lioness within Ana will resurface to take up her trusted naginata, transform the hunted into the hunter, and unsheathe… The Return of the Warrior.
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
In Return of the Warrior, Shi creator Billy Tucci is joined by co-writer Steven Peros, co-artist Ricardo Silva, colorist HI-FI Colour Design, designer Mindy Lopkin and superstar cover artists Amanda Conner, Paul Mounts, Wes Hartman, Conny Valentina and Mike Renzine. 
Our Troops
Special Guest Cover Artists!
Cover by Amanda Conner
And as a very special bonus the legendary George Perez (colored by Wes Hartman) has gracefully come out of retirement to provide one last and unforgettably beautiful Shi cover. 
Cover by George Perez

updates.update_content:
HAIKYO KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE LAUNCHES TODAY!
Crusade Comics’ Shi: Haikyo, the sequel to the critically acclaimed, Return of the Warriorlaunches today, January 4th at 8pm EST (5pm PST) on Kickstarter.
After the terrifying events ofReturn of the Warrior, Ana Ishikawa must now save her teenage daughter Hotaru who’s been kidnapped by a murderous “Shi” copycat killer. But to do so, she’s forced to ally herself with her lifelong enemy, the manipulative Masahiro Arashi. But what if it is all a ruse leading Ana into a deadly trap set by the Yakuza Oyabun?

Dear Return of the Warrior Backer!
I hope everyone is enjoying the first weekend of 2021. New Year's is a time to renew. A time for rebirth and a fresh new start. Deborah and I have been working hard on the Shi: Haikyo Kickstarter page (you've might have noticed some changes going on with it,) so that when we launch the campaign in a little over 48 hours on Monday, January 4th at 8pm, EST it will be ready down to the most minute detail.

campaign.story:
Now About Those STRETCH GOALS…
Unfortunately, I will have very limited internet access on the last day of the IMPOSSIBLE JONES Kickstarter since I'll be flying to Spain for the Metropoli Gijon Comic Convention! I will check in when I can, but here's the game plan:
You've already added coolness to our Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition of IMPOSSIBLE JONES! Thank You!
Endsheets— like bedsheets— can seem boring, but they're that extra touch that really brings everything together.
Now this is swanky! And an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition deserves no less!
Given Imp's uncanny ability to alter her appearance, Paper Dolls are a natural! Not only will she have different outfits (since she can shape-shift her uniform, too) but different arms, extra arms, etc. A quick and easy way to explain Imp's powers to people you meet at cocktail parties.
$50,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
Probably the IMPOSSIBLE JONES logo. But maybe a nice shot of IMP herself. Tell you what— this gets unlocked, you can vote on what the pin will look like!
$51,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
How are you going to tell the good guys from the bad— especially in IMP's world— without Trading cards?!
$52,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
I would love, love, love to do this. We just have to be able to pay for the privilege.
You worked hard getting the word out about IMPOSSIBLE JONES— and succeeded by sharing, posting, and re-tweeting images like this:
Thanks to several successful re-tweet campaigns every Backer will get IMPOSSIBLE JONES DIGITAL WALLPAPERS and this special KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE IMPOSSIBLE JONES STICKER (PDF for Digital Backers; delivered upon successful completion of the campaign, of course):
NOT TO MENTION (Since we are funded, after all):
We now return to the IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY Kickstarter, already in progress…
A thief gets powers, is mistaken for a superhero— and runs with it. Why not? Comes with some great perks. Of course, she has no intention of reforming— with these powers? Are you kidding?!— it's just sometimes there's no better place to hide than in plain sight.
IMPOSSIBLE, you say?
EXACTLY!
Imagine Harley Quinn meets Plastic Man in the Marvel Universe with a little Dick Tracy thrown in. Kind of. 
That's IMPOSSIBLE JONES! 
IMP in her native habitat.
I first thought of IMPOSSIBLE JONES as a monthly comic— but the first "issue" became 27 epic pages, so now it's a 132-page (or more!) Graphic Novel collecting what would have been the first 5 "issues" of her comic— the irrepressible Imp's entire Origin Story!
And IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY isn't just any graphic novel, but an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition Graphic Novel! 
Working design only. But still— pretty cool!
HARDCOVER!
 OVERSIZED! (7.5x11 inches!)
 110 PAGES OF STORY! (if not more!)
Introduction by the impossibly generous and talented GAIL SIMONE! 
 PIN-UPS by AMANDA CONNER! HOWARD CHAYKIN! TOM GRUMMETT! PETE WOODS! And others!
 BEHIND-THE-SCENES sketches and stories!
PLUS (if the Stretch Goal Gods smile on us):
 SPOT GLOSS on the cover!
FULL-COLOR ENDSHEETS!
SWANKY RIBBON BOOKMARK!
Of course, IMPOSSIBLE JONES is a new character. You know nothing about her. Let's fix that…
A SHORT TIME LATER…
Want to see the MISSING PAGES from this mini-adventure? Support this project and you get the whole story in UPDATE #1— for Backers only!
The amusing-if-somewhat-morally-ambiguous adventures of IMPOSSIBLE JONES are brought to you by:
Karl loves his job far more than he has any right to. He has written, inked, and occasionally penciled: Superman, Superboy, Harley Quinn, Spider-man, Suicide Squad, Fantastic Four, Captain America and many others— although he has an inexplicable fondness for obscure characters no one else remembers. His current obsessions are his creator-owned comics with Tom Grummett— SECTION ZERO— and David Hahn— IMPOSSIBLE JONES (you may have heard of her)! Waiting in the wings: SAINT MAYHEM! Karl lives in Portland, Oregon with his wonderful wife Myrna, their energetic son Isaac, and cute-as-a-bug daughter Eliza. He really can’t complain about much.
David's work is decidedly contemporary and reflects his eye for crisp detail. He has illustrated Marvel's Spider-man Loves Mary Jane, and Marvel Adventures: The Fantastic Four, DC's Batman ’66 Meets Wonder Woman ’77, and Vertigo's Bite Club, Fables, and Lucifer, as well as The Batman Handbook. David was nominated for both an Eisner Award and an Ignatz Award for his creator-owned comic series Private Beach, published by Slave Labor Graphics. An avid … who loves video games, David has somehow found himself living in bear and cougar country in the backwoods of western Montana.
AIDING AND ABETTING THESE TWO: 
Tony Avina— an American comic book colorist. Born and raised in the South Bay area of Los Angeles, he began his career working for Wildstorm Production in 2001. Since then he’s worked for DC Comics, Marvel, Image, Dark Horse and Dynamite Entertainment. Some of his notable projects are The Boys, Happy, Sleeper, Richard Dragon, Suicide Squad: Hell to Pay and Batman ‘66 Meets the Green Hornet.
ALSO: The crafty COMICRAFT gang on letters.  
No, the book is not done.
The first chapter/issue is totally complete. The second chapter/issue only has letters, colors and some inks left to finish. There are still three more chapters/issues to produce.
With your support, David and I are confident we can finish that over the next handful of months.
But to make the wait a little easier, we do have some lovely Reward Levels to offer you…
YOU GIVE. WE GIVE BACK. ONLY FAIR.
I will hand-deliver these to any shop within *REASONABLE* driving distance of Portland, Oregon. So for those lucky ducks: NO POSTAGE!
NOTE: Both books will be shipped together, once IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY has been printed.
NOTE: All three books will be shipped together, once IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY and SECTION ZERO 1959 have been printed.

YOU IN THE SPOTLIGHT!
AWESOME ART OPPORTUNITIES!

Here's where things get fun(ner). Stretch Goals will alternate between something that makes the book better— spot gloss on cover, full color endsheets, etc.— and something for everyone who has pledged at THE GOODS— BUT BETTER! level or above— trading cards, stickers, cloisonne pins, etc.
So the more money raised, the more cool stuff you get— at no extra cost to you! (As long as you've pledged at THE GOODS— BUT BETTER! level or above.)
It is impossible to show how much coolness spot gloss adds to a book's cover. For an Ultra-Cool Collector's Edition, it's a gotta-have.
Given Imp's uncanny ability to alter her appearance, Paper Dolls are a natural! Not only will she have different outfits (since she can shape-shift her uniform, too) but different arms, extra arms, etc. A quick and easy way to explain Imp's powers to people you meet at cocktail parties.
$50,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
$51,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
$52,000 STRETCH GOAL instantly added to everyone pledging at or above THE GOODS– BUT BETTER! level.
NOTE: Until actually unlocked, all Stretch Goals may be changed or modified as new, cooler ideas come to me!
If you followed my SECTION ZERO campaigns, you know I vowed to get a tattoo to commemorate every successful Kickstarter I run. I stand by that vow! I now have two SECTION ZERO tatts, and would love— LOVE!— to add one for IMPOSSIBLE JONES.
Only YOU can make that possible. Only YOU can get me to decorate (or desecrate, depending on your view) my body— by getting IMPOSSIBLE JONES funded! Whatever ends up on my arm (or leg) is in your hands! (So to speak.)
First: DON'T PANIC!
Approximate postage costs will be:
UNITED STATES: $8
CANADA: $15
THE REST OF THE WORLD: $25
Fingers crossed, those numbers won't change much.
Postage will be charged after the campaign ends, when the survey goes out and we know exactly how much it will cost.
This way we don't end up with an under-estimated postal bill that cripples us, and you don't end up with an over-inflated postage charge based on assumptions and guesses.
Our surveys will be handled by BACKERKIT, who has done this many, many times before. The process is simple, safe, and painless. You will be glad we're doing it this way. Trust us.
Truly and sincerely, I am constantly amazed and humbled by the power of people like you to make, well, the impossible possible. Making comics— and specifically making creator-owned comics like IMPOSSIBLE JONES— is what I want to do most in the world, but I can't do it without you. It doesn't even exist without you, without your support and belief. Thank you for that, and so much more.
Thank you for BELIEVING IN IMPOSSIBLE.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've run three Kickstarters— two of them very successful. I learn from my mistakes, and try to make each campaign better and run more smoothly than the last one. I have every reason to believe IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY will be my best-run and most quickly fulfilled Kickstarter yet.

That said: stuff happens. And if/when something does happen, I will let you know details and solutions as quickly as possible. I want this book done and in your hands— without sacrificing quality, of course— as much as you do. With my persistence and your patience (if needed), that's exactly what will happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
First Things First:
A handful of you have not received your copy of IMPOSSIBLE JONES: GRIN & GRITTY yet. My deepest apologies for that.
62 OF YOU HAVE NOT RESPONDED TO THE SURVEY. You don't respond, I don't get your mailing address, you don't get the book. That's simply how it works, I'm afraid. I just sent out a new reminder to the people who I'm still waiting on. If you get one of these reminders, respond to it.

Hope Everyone's Staying Safe and Warm Out There!
Here at Epicenter: IMPOSSIBLE! we're working hard on the next IMPOSSIBLE JONES book— a 28-page, stand-along comic featuring IMP and Holly Daze! I think I've got Page 1 around here somewhere…
AH! Here it is— !

BlackBox has shipped all the IMPOSSIBLE JONES orders they have!
I am thrilled to tell you that, and hopefully you are (or soon will be) just as thrilled when the IMP book is in your hands.
Many people got emails notifying them their book was on its way. Many did not. I have no idea why this happened— possibly because BlackBox is in transition (see below)— but everyone was supposed to be notified, with tracking numbers.

updates.update_userinfo: FUNNY THING HAPPENED ON THE WAY TO THE KICKSTARTER…
updates.update_content:
Remember how I said the Kickstarter for IMP 2 would launch on January 19th?
Plans have changed. 
All for the better, I'd say.
This happened because late last week I got an unexpected royalty check from DC Comics. For a substantial amount. Enough that I took a step back and thought about what I really to do with IMP— what would benefit the character most?

campaign.story:
Batman artist Graham Nolan once again teams up with Ominous Press, bringing you a story 20 years in the making! Ominous Press is very proud to present classic adventure tale of two Navy pilots arriving on a lost island populated by giant monsters and strange aliens: Graham Nolan's Return to Monster Island!
Two years have passed since our heroes, Mac and Duke escaped from their adventure on Monster Island. Now the island has once more appeared on earth, this time OVER the Bering Sea, and our stalwart pilots are once more called to service!
An alien group has taken over the island from the Gooch and Mac and Duke, with the aid of two Russian flyers have to set things right. Can they do it before the island phases out again?
Find out when you read the long awaited sequel to Monster Island...RETURN TO MONSTER ISLAND!
Also available is an all new, full color, version of the story that started it all, Graham Nolan's Monster Island. Printed in an oversized hardcover, this bad boy is beautifully colored by Gregory Wright and is printed at the same size as Graham Nolan's Return to Monster Island to make a complete set.
Kelly “Mac” MacGruder is a brave, strong-willed, Radar Intercept Officer. She’s a romantic at heart, and in love with Duke, but won’t let him know that!
Tommy “Duke” Mitchell is a top-gun Navy pilot, and a huge fan of John Wayne. Cool and confident, Duke thinks he’s a real ladies man ... and, in fact, he is!
(Maj.) Vitaliy Ivanoff is a top Russian MiG-31 pilot. Vitaliy is a proud Russian, well educated and ambitious. He desperately wants to acquire Gooch alien technology.
(Cpt.) Sergei Rustam the WSO (Weapon Systems Operator) of the Russian MiG-31. Sergei is not the sharpest tool in the Russian shed but he is loyal to Vitaliy and his country. He will do what must be done for mission fulfillment.
Awol is a former member of the Gooch (the caretakers of Monster Island), and now the rebel leader. He is a creature of great dignity, very polite, with a slow-burning but powerful fuse.
Rooster is a rebel, somewhat lazy, and although he has a very gruff exterior, is a softy at heart.
 The monsters on the island rule the surface, air and water in their containment zone. If anybody finds themselves within their domain … well, that’s just too bad for them!
The long awaited sequel, Return to Monster Island and the all new colorized version of Graham Nolan's classic Monster Island are here, and you can get the full story in a few different ways including these gorgeous, oversized, hardcovers!
Return to Monster Island and the all new colorized version of the classic Monster Island
RETURN TO MONSTER ISLAND SINGLE ISSUE VARIANT COVERS!
Own the full set of Return to Monster Island single issue comics! All hand signed by Graham Nolan, the full set features the whole story in a three issue run and boasts the amazing covers of Butch Guice (#1), Lee Weeks (#2), and Jose Luis Garcia-Lopez (#3).  Each cover is strictly limited to just 100 hand-numbered issues, available individually or as a set!
Also available: Artist Graham Nolan defined an entire era of  Batman comics, including co-creating the villain Bane. Now Graham delves  into his files to present a hardcover collection of classic images,  private commissions, and personal work, much of it never published  before. BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF GRAHAM NOLAN is more than 100 pages of artwork and commentary from a classic comic artist!
THE MONSTER BOX
The first of three limited boxed sets! For a pledge of $165 or more The Monster Box contains hardcover copies of both the colorized Monster Island and Returned to Monster Island as well as a Monster Island T-shirt and an amazing pin-up set featuring the art of Lee Weeks, Butch Guice, Jose Luis Garcia-Lopez, Kelley Jones, Pat Olliffe, Tom Richmond, Mark Nelson, and Bart Sears! As an additional bonus, you’ll also get digital copies of the colorized Monster Island and Return to Monster Island! The Monster Box  is limited to just 20, so act fast!
THE EPIC MONSTER BOX!
The second of our limited box series. For a pledge of $250 or more, you can be one of ten people to own the EPIC Monster Box. Contents include both the colorized Monster Island and Returned to Monster Island as well as a Monster Island T-shirt and an amazing pin-up featuring the art of Lee Weeks, Butch Guice, Jose Garcia-Lopez, Kelley Jones, Pat Olliffe, Tom Richmond, Mark Nelson, and Bart Sears! Also included is a one-of-a-kind inked head sketch by Graham Nolan of a character of your choosing, and digital copies of the colorized Monster Island and Return to Monster Island!
THE "YOU REALLY LOVE MONSTERS" BOX!
The last of our limited box series. For a pledge of $400 or more, five lucky backers will take home the “You Really Love Monsters Box!” Contents include both the colorized Monster Island and Returned to Monster Island as well as a Monster Island T-shirt and an amazing pin-up featuring the art of Lee Weeks, Butch Guice, Jose Garcia-Lopez, Kelley Jones, Pat Olliffe, Tom Richmond, Mark Nelson, and Bart Sears! Also included is a one-of-a-kind inked torso sketch by Graham Nolan of a character of your choosing, the Return to Monster Island single issue variant cover set, and digital copies of the colorized Monster Island and Return to Monster Island!
ORIGINAL ART REWARDS!
Graham DOES NOT SELL HIS ORIGINAL ART but now you have an opportunity to get an original from the artist himself! Graham has opened his vault and is releasing three BEAUTIFUL ORIGINALS that can be yours at two new MONSTER pledge levels! 
KNIGHTQUEST HOUSE AD (Batman) Original Art!
KNIGHTQUEST HOUSE AD original art by Graham Nolan!
Own this piece of DC Comics history, the KNIGHTQUEST House Ad original art by Graham Nolan! With inks by Scott Hanna! KNIGHTQUEST was a massive multi-part storyline published by DC Comics from 1993-1994. This awesome work of art features Batman, Nightwing and Robin! At this level you also receive digital and physical copies of the colorized Monster Island as well as digital and physical copies of Return to Monster Island. 
DETECTIVE COMICS #701, Page 2 and 3 Spread Original Art!
DETECTIVE COMICS #701, Pages 2+3 original art by Graham Nolan!
You can own this beautiful paneled spread from Detective Comics #701 by Graham Nolan! Featuring Nightwing, Robin, Huntress and Batman, this is a spectacular, one of a kind piece of comic art! Admit it; this would look awesome on your wall! At this level you also receive digital and physical copies of the colorized Monster Island as well as digital and physical copies of the all new sequel, Return to Monster Island. 
HEAD SKETCH REWARD
Legendary Batman artist Graham Nolan will create a one-of-a-kind head sketch of one of your favorite characters – just for you. Receive a beautiful, inked head sketch that measures 5 inches by 8 inches that any Nolan fan would be proud to display.
This reward also includes both physical and digital copy of Return to Monster Island. Shipping costs to be calculated when the campaign ends.
Graham Nolan Head Sketch examples.
TORSO SKETCH REWARD
The co-creator of Bane will create a gorgeous torso sketch of a character you love fully inked, that measures 9 inches by 12 inches on Bristol. This beautiful sketch by Graham can be yours at the $230 reward level.
This reward also includes both physical and digital copy of Return to Monster Island. Shipping costs to be calculated when the campaign ends.
Graham Nolan Torso Sketch examples.
 *THE PROLOGUE*
Two years have passed since the events depicted in MONSTER ISLAND. Now Mac, Duke, monsters galore, and the Gooch are all back! I’m so happy to finally bring the long-awaited sequel to my very patient fans! RETURN TO MONSTER ISLAND picks up where we left off, bringing another fun, wild ride. How does Monster Island return? Glad you asked! Here’s a sneak peek at our next saga. Enjoy!
    - Graham Nolan

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of work on the colorized version of Monster Island and Return to Monster Island is already complete. All art is in hand for the colorized version of Monster Island and coloring of those pages will be done before the campaign ends. The vast majority of art is in hand for Return to Monster Island, leaving just lettering to be finished before the book is sent for layout and production. 

Assuming we are successfully funded, both books will be sent to press shortly after the campaign's conclusion. Proofing, printing, and shipping to our offices will take a few weeks, and then fulfillment can begin. Delays due to unforeseen circumstances are always possible, but we anticipate a smooth process and on-time delivery.

updates.update_content:
The Black Hand is closing! We have only a few days left for BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2 on Kickstarter campaign! BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League is deluxe, hardcover graphic novel by the original creative team of Paul Harding, Ron Marz, and Matthew Dow Smith, an exciting horror espionage saga!
https://bit.ly/beastsoftheblackhand

We here at Ominous Press and Creation.Ink hope that you are safe and healthy in this challenging time.
We wanted to make you aware of an exciting project from a Friend of Ominous that is currently crowdfunding his newest graphic novel. You likely know writer/artist Graham Nolan from his legendary Batman work, including co-creating famed Bat-villain Bane, as well his two Ominous Press hardcover adventures, Monster Island and Return to Monster Island.
Graham’s latest project is a spine-chilling horror comic called THE CHENOO. Set in Buffalo (home to Ominous Press and Creation.Ink!), the terrifying tale reveals what happened during the the blizzard of 1977, when the blood-thirsty creature known as Chenoo came stalking out of the snow. Now in the present day, as another blizzard descends, the horror is happening all over again! Written and drawn by Graham Nolan, is classic horror by a classic creator!

Thank you for all your support of Ominous Press and Creation.Ink projects in the past! We literally could not do this without you. We wanted to make you aware of a new Kickstarter campaign we’ve just launched. Demi-God is an over-the-top superhero romp in which a typical slacker inherits the power of the legendary Hercules. Written by Ron Marz and illustrated by Andy Smith, Demi-God is one part Deadpool-inspired romp, one part Thor-style mythic adventure.

The Demi-God collected edition features all four issues of the mini-series, two of which have never been available previously. There’s also a bonus story, a complete cover gallery, and an expansive sketchbook section, all in a 144-page package. If we reach the $7,500 funding goal, collection will be a beautiful, comic-sized softcover. If we exceed the $15,000 goal, the entire package will be upgraded to an oversize hardcover volume!

The campaign can be found here:

As your Return to Monster Island and Monster Island color edition rewards start to reach your mailboxes, we thought you might like a peek at what one of our monstrous packages looks like. Creator Graham Nolan took the time to make this unboxing video, showcasing all the Monster Island goodness we have available.

Monster Island creator Graham Nolan stopped by our offices yesterday for a marathon signing session, slapping his autograph in all the pledged copies of Return to Monster Island, as well as the Monster Island color edition, and the very limited Monster Island single issues.

Our offices are overrun with monsters! As you can see, we have received our shipment of the Return to Monster Island and Monster Island color edition hardcovers. Both books turned out beautifully, and we’re anxious to get them into your hands. The fulfillment process has already started, and we are currently preparing packages to be shipped out to backers. Packages will ship out in waves, and reach you soon.

Greetings, Monster mavens! We come bearing good news! Today we will be delivering your digital downloads of Monster Island and Return to Monster Island via email. Your digital copies can be accessed by using the code we’ve provided. The code can be found in your download instructions. If you do not receive an email, please check your spam folder. For any questions, concerns or comments with your download, please contact us at: info@creation.ink
Physical copies of both books are due to be delivered from the printer to our fulfillment facility shortly. The exclusive variant cover comic issues have been printed. As soon as the hardcovers are delivered, all rewards will be packed securely and shipping will commence as soon as possible.

Good news, monster fans! The colored MONSTER ISLAND and RETURN TO MONSTER ISLAND books are at the printers, so it shouldn’t be too much longer before we can deliver them into your greedy little claws!
These types of projects always take longer than anticipated. So many variables are in play that are out of our control. But know this: you have not been forgotten, and the Creation.Ink team has been hard at work behind the scenes prepping and getting everything right!

The end is nigh! And by “the end,” we mean putting Return to Monster Island and the color Monster Island to bed, and getting them to the printer. Graham Nolan and editor-in-chief Ron Marz are doing their final proofs now, to make sure these volumes are perfect. Then our production staff will button up the files and send them off to the printer, and as soon as the printing schedule allows, the printed hardcovers will be shipped to our Buffalo-area facility, ready for fulfillment. Your digital copies, of course, will reach you first.

Hello, MI fans, this is the main man coming at you to let you know we are continuing to move forward on R2MI so we can get it to your claws as soon as possible!
The art and color is done and off to the letterer. Everything takes a little longer than you expect in this biz, but I guess that’s life in general too.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your patience, loyalty, and support! None of this is possible without you!

campaign.story:
Robbie Mack and the creative crew at Vigilante Comix are raising funds for the printing and distribution of the first issue of Crude Awakening, a fun and freaky trilogy of terror. 
This first issue of Crude Awakening is a 20 page full-color comic book of standard size. (6.63" wide by 10.24" tall) It’s a contemporary spin on the zombie genre with action, suspense and violence. Written by Robbie MacK, illustrated by Dario Carrasco and colored by Natalia Nesteranko. The zombies in Crude Awakening were inspired by the horror feature film, Peelers, with permission from the Director, Sevé Schelenz.
The first issue also includes these awesome variant covers by Italian artist, Leo Colapietro.
Custom commissions from Leo of any mainstream character are also available for only $295! Check the Commission Crude pledge package for details. Here are some examples of his previous work.
Bryn Walker, is the unlucky police officer that first discovers one of the Shaman's victims. She is called to investigate a burned-out house, inhabited by a homeless teenage boy and his infected girlfriend.
After narrowly escaping a violent altercation with the zombified teenage girl, Bryn rushes back to her department headquarters to find it has been over-run by zombies. She joins the few remaining survivors, including her partner John Redcrow, as they mount a last-ditch defense of the town against the crazed horde of zombies.  John has a hunch that this outbreak might be more than a freak of nature... it could be a reckoning!
You'll never look at oil the same way again!
Click HERE to view a 7-page PDF preview of issue 1.  
While Crude Awakening can be enjoyed as a fun, gore-filled zombie apocalypse, it also tackles some troublesome themes faced by contemporary Canadian society. Such themes include the country's angst towards the production of crude oil and the plight of the First Nations people.
Now that you've read about the story, take a look at these awesome rewards!  We've tried to put together a full spectrum of pledge packages that should cater to everyone's tastes and budgets. In addition to the great sequential page art by Dario and Natalia, I'm really excited to offer the four alternative cover designs by Italian artistic prodigy, Leo Colapietro. These masterpieces are available as pinups in the Digital edition PDF, as pinups or posters in the print packages and as t-shirts too! At this point, we only have plans to do a print run using one of them as a variant cover, but if we hit our stretch goals, we could end up offering them ALL as variant covers!  
Check out the animated GIF below that showcases Leo's ingenious creative process.

Here are the pledge package descriptions. All pledge amounts are in $CAD. Let us know if you have any questions or special requests and we'll try to get back to you right away. 
 Here's a little info about the talented team that's bringing you this tale of terror! 
Here's some feedback from backers of previous Vigilante Comix campaigns.
We really appreciate you helping us raise the funds to bring this project to life! People like you enable us to do what we love, which is creating comics! Here's the budget breakdown for how the funds we raise will be spent. If we exceed this funding goal, we have plans to offer you lots of great stretch goal rewards!

That's all we got for this campaign page. You can check out our web site at www.vigilantecomix.com for more information and don't hesitate to send us a question or post a comment via this Kickstarter page.

Hi Everyone,
I've launched a new comic campaign on Kickstarter! Hildebrand Valkyrie Volume 1 is a 48 page graphic novella, written by myself, illustrated by Italian sensation Luca Casalanguida (Dynamite's James bond) and colored by rising Russian star, Natalia Nesterenko (Bubble Comics). It tells the story of a courageous female knight in medieval England who defends her village from a Viking invasion and then embarks on a perilous journey to Rome to verify her divine family lineage. This is a classic medieval fantasy story with a few twists that will entertain readers young and old! Check out the campaign page HERE!

Who is ZOMBIE-SAMA?!?
Imagine the horror when sushi delivery boy Jim Okami realizes the citizens of his small town are literally being eaten alive by nuclear-contaminated Zombies! 
As all Hell breaks loose around him, the desperate former slacker grabs the lone katana from above the restaurant's cash register and is heroically reborn as teen sensation ZOMBIE-SAMA!
Now armed with sword and chainmail armor conveniently appropriated from a local scuba shop, our hero sets out to save his friends from the irradiated flood of rancorous fallout freaks! 
Defiant Jane Variant Cover by Asha Kishna and Wes Hartman
Co-creators Billy Tucci (Shi, Sgt. Rock, Miss Fury) and John Broglia (God Complex, Atomic Robo) are joined by digital colorist Paul Little and letterer/designer Mindy Lopkin for a full-color, 60-page graphic novel. Goriously-good variant covers are offered by Billy, John and European rising star Asha Kishna.  
All 60 pages of artwork is complete, and we just have to finalize our coloring and lettering. In addition, we have the art and swag you desire, with offerings of prints, challenge coins, T-shirts and more!  
As an added BONUS we’re offering a very, very special reward… a preview ashcan comic for the upcoming “Shi – Return of the Warrior”! The ashcan will ONLY be available to those who pledge for this Kickstarter. You will not be able to get it anywhere else.  
So please PLEDGE and help our team to make Zombie-Sama, a reality.  
John Broglia and Sean Callahan's Akira Homage Variant Cover Edition
On a personal note, I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for 25 Wonderful years in comics. You have all literally changed my life.
So, thank you, please pledge, share and remember… 
#peacelovezombiesama
 - Billy Tucci
Shi Return of the Warrior Ashcan Cover by Billy Tucci and HI-Fi
Hoku-Zombie Hard Cover Edition Cover by Billy Tucci and Wes Hartman
***ALL COMICS/BOOKS/PRINTS come AUTOGRAPHED BY Billy Tucci and John Broglia unless otherwise requested in pledge message.***
