Here’s a peek at a few pages...
WANT MORE????
AND CONTINUE TO CHECK BACK FOR MORE ADDED PLEDGE REWARD LEVELS TOO!
MEET TEAM ZOMBIE-SAMA! 
Billy Tucci - Writer 
 Billy Tucci is an award-winning cartoonist best known for his modern-day samurai fable, “Shi”.  Through Billy’s Crusade Fine Arts, the multi-Eisner Award-nominated Shi has been printed in five languages sold more than 3 million comic books.  He has also worked on a litany of projects for DC Comics’ including “Sgt. Rock”, “Harley Quinn”, “Flash Vs. Superman” and “Batman.” 
His earnest retelling of the Christmas story, “A Child Is Born” has quietly turned into a international blockbuster after winning the Christian Small Publisher Book of the Year Award. 
2019 celebrates Shi’s 25th Anniversary with the release of the“Shi – Return of the Warrior” and “Shi – Hotaru” graphic novels accompanied by new Shi action figures, statues and reprints. Billy’s also bringing about the return of Golden Age Icon “Miss Fury” for Dynamite Entertainment and two new creator owned projects, “Zombie-Sama!” and “Appalachian Apocalypse” as well as “Wonder Woman” for DC Comics.
 John Broglia - Artist
 John Broglia Zombie-Sama! Co-Creator John Broglia is a New York based cartoonist who's love for comics dates back to his early childhood. He attended the School of Visual Arts in Manhattan where he studied animation. Early on in his career he worked on several creator owned projects, including Image Comics' God Complex with Michael Avon Oeming. He has also supplied art for anthology series such as Atomic Robo: Real Science Adventures and Image Comic’s Where We Live. 
John has been a part of several successful Kickstarter campaigns, his most prominent with writer Michael Sarrao on Unmasked volumes 1 and 2. John is currently working on Harriet Tubman: Demon Slayer and other creator owned projects.
 Paul Little - Colorist
 Paul Little is a colorist who has worked on a number of licensed properties like Darkwing Duck and Sons of Anarchy, as well as Eisner and Harvey Award-nominated titles like Morning Glories and Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream. He lives in Niagara Falls.
 Mindy Lopkin - Letterer/Designer
 Mindy Lopkin works as a freelance comic book letter and she enjoys a good challenge. She has worked extensively with Amrit Birdi & Co one of which was youtube sensation, Joe Sugg’s Username Series (the first book of the trilogy, Username: Evie, was the fastest-selling graphic novel in UK history). 
She has worked on multiple projects for Markosia Enterprises and Horizon Line Comics, as well as working on many indie comics including Unmasked: Volume 2 with Michael Sarrao, John Broglia and Paul Little. She was also part of an all-female creative team behind Advent Comics one-shot, titled Sunshine.
J.C. Vaughn - Editor
J.C. Vaughn is the Vice-President of Publishing at Gemstone Publishing, home of THE OVERSTREET COMIC BOOK PRICE GUIDE, among other books. He is the writer-creator of BEDTIME STORIES FOR IMPRESSIONABLE CHILDREN, THE FLIGHT, VAMPIRE, PA, and ZOMBIE-PROOF. He has co-written 24, STARGATE ATLANTIS and STARGATE UNIVERSE with Mark L. Haynes, MIGHTY SAMSON with Jim Shooter, and SHI with Billy Tucci. 
J.C. is also presently editing STOKER AND WELLS: ORDER OF THE GOLDEN DAWN.
Asha Kishna - Featured Variant Cover Illustrator 
Break-out cover artist, Asha KIshna met Billy Tucci at a convention appearance in the Netherlands and he was blown away by her dynamic pencils and striking inking and storytelling. Her "Jane Defiant" cover captures the Millennial generations sentiments that no matter how horrible things are going, there's always time to "strike a pose." She has several upcoming projects from a variety of publishers (including Crusade) and we are excited about her amazing future in comics!

campaign.story:
"Because you demanded it. By popular demand, here's my very first art book collecting all my major ballpoint pen art. Not only will this book  contain my unique ballpoint pen drawings, but I'll reveal all my  step-by-step ballpoint pen techniques as well. I hope you enjoy this  book as much as I enjoyed making it. And as always, thank you for your  support. You fans are the greatest." --Frank Cho
Frank Cho and Flesk have partnered again to create his latest art book Ballpoint Beauties! This book is available as an affordable paperback and hardcover, and as a premium signed deluxe edition. Luxurious signed prints are also available. Enjoy the samples and details below. Thank you for visiting!
Mature Warning: Ballpoint Beauties contains a lot of nudity. We think the book is tasteful, but nevertheless you may want to use your discretion if you are gifting this book to anybody under 18.
All pledges of $20 or more come with a free exclusive postcard set!
Stretch Goal #1 Unlocked! We are adding two gatefolds to the book. The page count has increased to 104 pages!
Stretch Goal #2 Unlocked! We are adding 5" french flaps to the paperback edition. (See update #2 for details.)
Stretch Goal #3 Unlocked!  We are adding an additional 16 pages to the book! Frank is drawing more new material to fill its pages. This has increased the page count to 120 pages!
Stretch goal #4 Unlocked! We are upgrading the bonus postcard set to 7 and increasing the size to 5 x 7"! This is free for everyone who pledges $20 or more.
Stretch goal #5 Unlocked! We will add a slipcase to the Ballpoint Beauties deluxe signed book ($45 tier book)!
Stretch goal #6 Unlocked! We will add a specially designed envelope to house the postcard set that Frank will sign!
See stretch goal section for more details. 
Ballpoint Beauties Book
Ballpoint Beauties is 120 pages at 9 x 12 inches and includes two gatefolds. Paperback, hardcover, and deluxe signed hardcover edition is on offer. More pages were added when stretch goals #1 and #3 were unlocked!
Ballpoint Beauties has been Frank Cho’s most requested book on social media over the past year. He has been making his personal ballpoint pen drawings purely for himself for over two decades. This is the first time that these rarely seen works have been captured into a dedicated volume. Compiled here are his favorites, many which are done recently specially for this book. Many pieces are shown in four stages that are accompanied by Frank's commentary to reveal his process. He is completely self-taught which makes for a unique and educational experience.
Included within the book are visual guides for anatomy and body parts, plus a short interview where Frank discusses his working methods and answers the most common questions that he receives online. Also shown are comic covers for his creator owned property Skybourne, where he has incorporated ballpoint pen in a mixed media format to show you how to incorporate the ballpoint pen into commercial assignments.
Premium Signed Giclée Prints
Only available to our Kickstarter supporters during this campaign! These four signed luxurious 13 x 19" museum quality giclée prints feature Frank Cho's favorite and most popular works. Prints for the cover to Ballpoint Beauties, the artwork “End,” along with his Liberty Meadows "Cow Standing," and “Lost World” are offered. These prints utilize 290 gsm acid free matte paper that is water resistant and they are printed with archival and fade resistant inks. The "End" print will be uncensored.
Kickstarter Bonus Item
Upgraded! All pledges of $20 or more come with a free postcard set! These seven 5 x 7" postcards highlight Frank's classic ballpoint pen pieces. This art will not be included within the Ballpoint Beauties book. All postcard art will be uncensored.
Stretch goal #6 has been unlocked and we will add a specially designed envelope to house the postcard set that Frank will sign!
This item will be available nowhere else and is exclusive to this campaign. This is just one way we would like to thank you for supporting us!
All Kickstarter bonus items are limited to one per backer.
Original Art Tiers--Only Eight Available!  
Frank is making eight of his super rare ballpoint pen originals available to help fund this project. All of these pieces will be included in the book. These are done on 300 series Strathmore bristol board using ballpoint pen. "Brandy Float Pen Art" is done on 14 x 21" paper. "Kneeling Woman" is done on 11 x 17" paper. "Rose" is done on 12 x 19" paper. "Study of Michelangelo’s Libyan Sibyl" is done on 11 x 17" paper. "Vamp" is done on 12 x 19" paper. "Woman With Blanket" is done on 14 x 21" paper. "Woman With Drapery" is done on 11 x 18" paper. "Zeus Head" is done on 11 x 17" paper. Uncensored versions can be provided for serious potential buyers. These originals are sensitive to light and should be stored appropriately. Like watercolor, the ballpoint pen can fade if placed in prolonged direct light. These original art tiers include the signed deluxe edition book, all four premium signed prints, and all of the Kickstarter bonus items.
Stretch Goals
Stretch goals allow us to thank you for  your growing support by rewarding you with exclusive bonus items just  for our Kickstarter supporters.
1. UNLOCKED! We will add two gatefolds to the book! This will increase the page count to 104 pages!
2. UNLOCKED! We are adding 5" french flaps to the paperback edition. This is an upgraded bonus to make this edition extra fancy. (See Update #2 for a visual reference about what a French flap is.)
3. UNLOCKED! We are adding an extra 16 pages of content to the book! This has increased the page count to 120 pages!
4. UNLOCKED! Postcard Set Upgrade! We will add two more postcards to the free bonus postcard set. Instead of 5 postcards you will get a set of 7. Also, we have increased the size from  4 x 5" to 5 x 7"! All pledges of $20 or more receive this bonus item.
5. UNLOCKED -- Deluxe Edition Slipcase! We are adding a slipcase to the Ballpoint Beauties deluxe signed book ($45 tier book)!
6. UNLOCKED  -- Signed Envelope for Postcard Set!  We are adding a specially designed envelope to hold the bonus  postcard set that Frank will sign. This would get everyone a Frank Cho autograph who pledges $20 or more.
All Kickstarter stretch goal bonus items are limited to one per backer.
Add-Ons
Add-on anything to anything! An Add-On lets you  pledge for more than one tier by adding the price of any additional tier  to your existing pledge. Say you want to include an extra book? Simply  add-on the additional cost of the second item to your pledge and let us know. You will also  need to increase the shipping charge, which varies by item and country. Email us for the total cost. If you have any questions we are  here to help.
About Frank Cho
Frank Cho is one of the most popular artists working in comics today. He is known for his creator owned properties Liberty Meadows and Skybourne, as well as his covers and interior artwork for Marvel Comics that include The Mighty Avengers, New Ultimates, Savage Wolverine, and Totally Awesome Hulk. For DC Frank has completed over 50 Harley Quinn covers that have proven to be wildly popular. Please note that there is no Marvel or DC artwork in this book.
Shipping Schedule
We expect to have  your pledges shipped to you in May 2019. The designs for the books and prints are nearly completed. We expect to send everything to the  printer by January 1st if we hit  our goal. It takes approximately three months for everything to be  printed, and then to be delivered to us. We will ship them to everyone  in May 2019 immediately upon their arrival at our Flesk warehouse  in Santa Cruz, CA.
All books are shipped within the U.S.A. by USPS Mail and will include tracking. Premium signed giclée prints shipped in  the U.S.A. will ship by USPS First Class mail (small prints) or  Priority Mail (larger prints or packages with multiple prints) and will include tracking.
The items shipped to our international friends usually take 3 weeks for delivery  to your local post office, but can sometimes take up to 3-6 weeks  depending on the country. Note that customs for your local country may  hold on to packages for a week or longer and incur additional charges that is the responsibility of the backer. We will not mark items as a "gift." We know that shipping  overseas is very expensive and we wish it was cheaper, too! We help by subsidizing some of the shipping cost. We make no money from the  shipping.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John Fleskes answers:

I pride myself on having a sixteen year record of delivering over eighty books of the highest quality. I've run ten previous Kickstarter campaigns with artists such as Brom, Frank Cho, J.A.W. Cooper, Jeffrey Alan Love, Gary Gianni and Mike Mignola (Hellboy: Into the Silent Sea Studio Edition), Petar Meseldzija, Richard and Wendy Pini (Elfquest), Mark Schultz, and Daren Bader and Lance HaunRogue. Most of these have been on time. We are very open with our backers and communicate through updates often to keep you up to date.

In some cases, things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published over eighty books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands when I said I would.

I can't thank everyone enough who has supported us before. You directly help us to make these beautiful books.

Hi everyone,
The Quick Version
All of the domestic and international Ballpoint Beauties  books by Frank Cho were shipped by August 1st. If you have not received your book yet, and you are overseas, please see the  International Orders section below for more details.

Hi everyone,
Thank you so much for your patience while we have been packing and shipping this new Frank Cho book 7 days a week since they arrived with us. 
The Quick Version
All of the domestic Ballpoint Beauties books by Frank Cho were shipped by last Tuesday. The remaining international books are being shipped now, with the remaining copies going in the mail by this Friday.

Hi, everyone,
After a record 12 days of sitting on the docks just one hour away from our Flesk warehouse, we finally received our shipment of Ballpoint Beauties books! I'm very grateful to you all for your patience.
As soon as we offloaded the books from the truck we began packing and shipping the books. At the moment, we have shipped all of the domestic paperback $20 tier, and the domestic hardcover $30 tier. We are currently working on packing the domestic $45 deluxe signed edition tier.

Hi, everyone, 
The shipper let us know that on Tuesday, July 9th, we will receive  the new Ballpoint Beauties by Frank Cho and the Art of Gary Gianni for  George R. R. Martin’s Seven Kingdoms books here at our Flesk warehouse. A  big part of this delay is due to the July 4th holiday when the truckers  take a four-day weekend.   
By that time these books arrive with us, they will have been sitting on the  docks/shipping yard, just one hour away from us, for 12 days. This is  one of those things that is out of our control, yet I still want to  apologize since I was expecting them sooner and we are eager to get you  your books as soon as possible.

Hi, everyone,
The Ballpoint Beauties books have arrived at the port of Oakland, CA. We are waiting for them to pass through customs. This usually takes a few days before they can truck the books over to our warehouse in Santa Cruz, which is just over an hour away. We hope to have the books next week. We have a full crew here ready to pack and ship the 3000+ Kickstarter pledges and pre-orders. Thank you all so much for your patience. We can't wait to get you your books!

campaign.story: Back in 2013, I launched a Kickstarter to make my comic book script a reality. The comic was called Robin Hood: Outlaw of the 21st Century, a modern-day update of the classic legend that sees Rob and his merry men scour the town of Sherwood for medicine, which they then steal to give to those in need, the 21st century equivalent of robbing from the rich to give to the poor. Thanks to the generosity of friends, family, colleagues and even strangers here on Kickstarter, the comic was drawn, printed and found its way into the hands of over 100 backers. After three more issues and the trade paperback collection, I have returned to Kickstarter for Robin Hood: Outlaw of the 21st Century #0, to tell the story of how Rob met his trusty sidekick Will Scarlet, and brought him into the fold. Fortunately, the same creative team is involved that brought you the previous issues. Unfortunately, creating your own comic is a costly endeavor, and that's where you come in.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The challenge is that if the project does not get funded, then the book is never finished. Also, what I didn't know the first time I ran a Kickstarter, but know only too well now, it costs money to promote your book to get people to buy it once it is finished, so some of the funds made here will be put towards promotion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy New Year, everyone! Hope you are enjoying your holiday season.
Just wanted to let you all know that I just received word from the printer that Robin Hood #0 has been shipped and is making it's way to my eager hands. So, as soon as I get them, I'll start shipping them out to all of you! This includes the folks who pledged for digital copies, as well (Didn't want you guys spoiling anything.) Mailing all that stuff can be time--consuming, so be patient, but hopefully it will all be worth it. Thanks again for your generosity!

Thanks to everyone who donated to the Kickstarter! Obviously, there's still time left to give, and the rewards are still available. And since we eclipsed 50 backers, everyone who selected a physical reward tier will receive a Robin Hood print colored by John Hunt.
Thanks again to all who donated, shared, gave advice, sent good vibes or whatever. You are all amazing!

updates.update_content:
Hey, folks,
I can't believe that Kickstarter stopped counting the days and now are counting the hours, but maybe that's to jolt people into donating. 
Whatever the case, yes, the project is 90% funded with 54 hours to go, as if this writing. As I said in my Live video the other day, all the reward tiers are still on the table, including the bottle openers, as I found that i had a couple more in my closet. So, if you're like me and like cracking open a cold one (even though so many beers come in cans now) while you read a comic, you can do it with a Robin Hood bottle opener.

Hey, everyone,
With one week left on this project, I can say that this is the time when every donation really helps. Well, for my sanity's sake, anyway. Of course, they all really help, no matter how big or small, but as far as trying to reach the goal, it really helps me to know that we are getting closer to Robin Hood #0 becoming a reality. So, thank you so much to everyone so far who had donated, and for anyone following and waiting until the end, well, you have seven days left.
The cover was just too good to keep a secret. Here is the John Hunt-colored version, which I originally said was the variant, but I may decide to make it cover A. We'll see how I feel that day.

As far as news, I will be adding a reward tier of a variant cover of issue #0 very soon, colored by John Hunt, who has been a colorist and letterer for years and is also my oldest friend (And by "oldest," I don't mean he's old. campaign.story:
The original Scifies Anthology series first ran from 2014-2015. Three issues were published and all stories were written by Ramon Gil. 
This 2018 edition is being produced by Ramon and is a collaboration between several artists and writers, some up-and-coming, and others, seasoned creators. Editing by Gregory Paul Silber.
The wonderful thing about Scifies and science fiction in general, is that it’s a genre that, more than any other, tries to imagine infinite possibilities for mankind. It’s a proactive exercise in predicting the future. It’s a world of vision and wonder.
Scifies 2018 is a collection of 8 stories comprising more than 52 pages and will be sure to bring out the sci-fi fan in you!
Stories are:
Galatea: a seemingly Utopian futuristic society has a sinister origin. By Meredith Moriarty
Tomorrow: A nightmarish, militaristic future might be more than it seems. By Claire Connelly 
Ocean of Loneliness: a vampire, the last of his kind, tries to survive in a world that's hunting him. By Paul Bradford, Allen Byrnes and Micah Myers.  
Name Day: a fantastical shopping trip for a young girl with her father. By Marta Tanrikulu, Daniel Franco and Robin Jones. 
The Long Event Horizon: a dangerous space expedition leads to an unforgettable conclusion! By Robert J. Sodaro and Ramon Gil. 
Spacegirl Speeda in Lazerville: a cosmic superheroine in the future makes an unusual friend. By Tue Sorensen and Peder Riis.
Lt. Yorick: As if the presence of a silent astronaut wasn't strange enough for this suburban family, ten-year-old Jude's nightmares hint at a catastrophic end for them all, in this otherworldly coming of age tale. By Matt Kelly and Nicolo Arcuti.
The Last Survivor: the story a lone soldier trying to make her last stand against an alien creature leads to a shocking twist. By Lynne Yoshii.
We hope you’ll join us on yet another adventure (or eight) spun by some amazing creators! So please pledge today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While some of us on this project are up-and-coming, we've all had published books before! This is the eleventh comic that I myself have produced, the only thing that would stop it's realization would be grave illness or a natural disaster. That and we don't meet our Kickstarter goal.

Ninety percent of the anthology is actually already done. So rest assured you will be getting your money's worth with Scifies 2018!

updates.update_content: Hi everyone! I'm seeing requests for updates on the printed book and I'm not sure if these are old or new. The books were printed out and shipped to all backers who responded with their address. If anyone did not get theirs, please email me at ramonsgil@gmail.com. Thanks!

Hey everyone,
We are just waiting for the books from the printers. In the meantime, I just sent out an email with a link to the Digital download for anyone who wants to read the book sooner rather than layer. Please check your mailboxes. 
I hope it was worth the wait. 
Ramon Gil

Hi everyone!
Here's a preview of the new cover! Coming to your mailbox (or inbox) soon!
Ramon

Dear friends,
Happy New Year! 
First off, please accept my apology for the lateness of our book. As I mentioned before, we had to replace an artist who left and the versatile Derwin Robertson took over with a new story, but just as he was finishing up, he got into an accident and needed some extra time. Luckily, we're one page away from completion . Below is a sample of one of those pages.

Hi everyone, we hit a little bump on the road with producing SCIFIES 2018. One of the creators had an opportunity they couldn’t pass up and had to pull out, story and all. Luckily, I had a sci-fi story in my back pocket that just needed art. The prolific Derwin Roberson has taken on the challenge and we should be back on track by month’s end. Books should be shipping out in November.
Thank you all for your patience!!

Hi everyone,
Thank you to all who pledged for a copy of Scifies 2018! We couldn't have done it without you all!
We're only a few pages away from completing the book then it's off to the printers! Expect it to go out next month along with whatever bonuses your pledge level warrants. A survey will be going out asking everyone for their addresses. Please fill them out so we can get your rewards out to you.

We're down to the last 72 hours! To help reach our goal, I am happy to offer the "yet-to-be-released" official first issue of THE PROFESSIONAL(s) to anyone who increases their pledge by $10 starting right now!
"Police detective Diego Kinkaid has been ordered by the mayor to play a superhero to give hope to a dying city. With the help of his former Special Forces team, they realize that playing superhero is easy but playing politics is deadly."

Hello all!
The very first comic project I ever Kickstarted was Scifies #1 way back in 2014. Back then I had written all the stories myself. Today, I've relaunched Scifies as an anthology of work from other creators I admire!
Scifies 2018 is full of fantastic stories that will boggle your mind and imagination! I hope you'll take a few moments to check it out and be intrigued enough to pledge for your copy of Scifies!

campaign.story:
Cover A
The small independent publishing company called  Paranoia Comics, is the dream of a few very passionate guys and gals looking to be creative and entertain both hard core comic book fans and casual readers alike. We strive to always better each project with every step forward, in the hopes to someday produce stories that can be pointed to as someone's favorite. Over the past several years, we have made a modist controbution to the industry while cautiously getting our feet wet. This year however, we would like to make a big splash as we team up with a new artist (Jason Seaux) and prepare to relaunch issue #1 of our flagship character, a zombie super hero named Necro-Man. This time around we have dilagnetly reworked the script and story structure to optimize our concept's full potential. The art for this book, that you will be able to preview in our video, promises to knock your socks off...Jason pulls no punches! As Halloween quickly approaches, the last few blocks of this puzzle are being put into place. With your help here on kickstarter, by making donations Necro-Man will be able to meet his DEADline and hopefully rise from the grave! All profit made from this campaign will be put towards printing costs and other minor expenses that will insure a much wider spread success in reaching more fans of our unique brand of story telling. We have gathered varius resources to put together some fun and exciting prizes to thank those of you who chose to support our dream. In advance, all fo us at Paranoia Comics would like to take the time to say thank you. We truly appreciate your stopping on our page to check us out and we aim to make you all fans in the future!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges are that of any small independent creators. We are not on the level of the two big companies that dominate the industry... nor are we even anywhere near the lower level companies that sit just below them. But what we do have, is hard working creative people that are passionate and dedicated to entertaining fans and giving them their moneys worth. Some of the most common expenses are of course paying artists, writers, and printing costs. Often, a casual fan may not be aware of other costs such as buying tables to sell at conventions, gas it takes to get to those conventions, and various other avenues required for promotion. Obviously we do not desire to become rich from this kickstarter campaign, but we would be forever grateful to any of those willing to support us and our childhood dream of making action packed comic books for everyone to enjoy!

campaign.story:
25K stretch Goal - Get a Monster Island T-Shirt!
Batman artist Graham Nolan is teaming up with Ominous Press to bring two very special projects to light. Ominous Press is very proud to present Graham Nolan's MONSTER ISLAND 20th Anniversary Creator Edition and Black Book: the Art of GRAHAM NOLAN!
MONSTER ISLAND 20th Anniversary Edition and Black Book: The Art of GRAHAM NOLAN
Monsters! Aliens! Romance! The Creator Edition of Monster Island celebrates the 20th Anniversary of the pulp-adventure classic written and illustrated by Batman artist Graham Nolan. Lovingly reproduced from the original art boards, this oversized edition includes the entire original story of stalwart heroes discovering an island overrun by monsters. There's also a wealth of extras, including new pin-ups by artists Lee Weeks, Jose Luis Garcia-Lopez, Butch Guice, Kelley Jones, Bart Sears, Pat Olliffe, and Mark A. Nelson, plus a brand-new short story paving the way for a full-color sequel!
Also available: Artist Graham Nolan defined an entire era of Batman comics, including co-creating the villain Bane. Now Graham delves into his files to present a hardcover collection of classic images, private commissions, and personal work, much of it never published before. BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF GRAHAM NOLAN is more than 100 pages of artwork and commentary from a classic comic artist, the next volume in the Ominous Press Black Book Series.
Crack Navy ace Tommy “Duke” Mitchell and his radar intercept officer, Kelly “Mac” MacGruder are on a routine mission when their Tomcat encounters an energy field and is forced to land on a mysterious, unknown island!
Duke and Mac become separated, and while trying to find each other, run across strange aliens, curious creatures, and giant monsters!
The clock is ticking as Mac and Duke have only 24 hours to get off the island before it phases to another part of the universe. Between the monsters and a revolution going on within the alien Gooch, it’s an all-out fight for survival against the denizens of MONSTER ISLAND!
Page 1 and 2 of Monster Island! The art will be presented exactly as it appears on the original art boards.
Kelly “Mac” MacGruder is a brave, strong-willed, Radar Intercept Officer. She’s a romantic at heart, and in love with Duke, but won’t let him know that!
Tommy “Duke” Mitchell is a top-gun Navy pilot, and a huge fan of John Wayne. Cool and confident, Duke thinks he’s a real ladies man ... and, in fact, he is!
The Gooch are an alien race and the caretakers of Monster Island. The original capitalists of the universe!
Rooster is a rebel, somewhat lazy, and although he has a very gruff exterior, is a softy at heart.
Quirt is a sarcastic tough guy whose motivations are all his own!
Awol is a former member of the Gooch, and now the rebel leader. He is a creature of great dignity, very polite, with a slow-burning but powerful fuse.
Princess Joo-Lea is a princess of the court of Sonan, who dared to love one who was not of royal lineage.
The monsters on the island rule the surface, air and water in their containment zone. If anybody finds themselves within their domain … well, that’s just too bad for them!
 From Graham Nolan:
They say that patience is a virtue. Well, my virtuous friends, your patience is being rewarded! Your 20-year wait is over! My partners at Ominous Press and I are planning to finally bring you the long-awaited Return to Monster Island!
The gang is all here as we pick up where we left off in the original Monster Island ... but the next chapter will be in living color. Please enjoy these teaser pages from the prologue story that appears in our new Creator's Edition of Monster Island.
Your support of our new edition of Monster Island will help pave the way for a full-blown sequel, Return to Monster Island. Who doesn't want more Monsters?
Enjoy!
RETURN to MONSTER ISLAND preview in full-color!
 The Art of GRAHAM NOLAN:
Famed for his long and storied Batman run, as well co-creating the villain Bane, Graham Nolan's career has spanned decades and a wide array of genres and characters. For the first time, a comprehensive collection of Graham's artwork is being offered in BLACK BOOK: THE ART OF GRAHAM NOLAN. Covering the breadth of Graham's art, from Marvel and DC Comics, comic strips like Sunshine State and Rex Morgan, M.D., private commissions, and personal work, the hardcover volume contains more than 100 pages of artwork and commentary. This is the fourth volume in the Ominous Press Black Book Series.
Images from the Black Book: the Art of Graham Nolan
 ORIGINAL ART REWARDS!
Just a few days left and we’ve saved some of the best for last… Graham DOES NOT SELL HIS ORIGINAL ART but now you have an opportunity to get an original from the artist himself! Graham has opened his vault and is releasing three BEAUTIFUL ORIGINALS that can be yours at three new MONSTER pledge levels!
PHANTOM SUNDAY STRIP Original Art!
PHANTOM Sunday Strip Original Art by Graham Nolan!
For a pledge of $675+ you can own this incredible, original piece of Graham Nolan PHANTOM art! The PHANTOM, created by Lee Falk, has been appearing in newspapers since 1936. This Sunday page by Graham was published on 10/30/2005. At this pledge level you also receive Monster Island Digital and Hardcover graphic novel, as well as the Black Book: the Art of Graham Nolan!
KNIGHTQUEST HOUSE AD (Batman) Original Art!
KNIGHTQUEST HOUSE AD original art by Graham Nolan!
For a pledge of $4,500.00+ you can own this piece of DC Comics history, the KNIGHTQUEST House Ad by Graham Nolan! With inks by Scott Hanna! KNIGHTQUEST was a massive multi-part storyline published by DC Comics from 1993-1994. This awesome work of art features Batman, Nightwing and Robin! At this level you also receive Monster Island Digital and Hardcover graphic novel, as well as the Black Book: the Art of Graham Nolan!
DETECTIVE COMICS #701, Page 2 and 3 Spread Original Art!
DETECTIVE COMICS #701, Pages 2+3 original art by Graham Nolan!
For a pledge of $9,000.00+ you can own this beautiful paneled spread from Detective Comics #701 by Graham Nolan! Featuring Nightwing, Robin, Huntress and Batman, this is a spectacular, one of a kind piece of comic art! Admit it; this would look awesome on your wall! At this level you also receive Monster Island Digital and Hardcover graphic novel, as well as the Black Book: the Art of Graham Nolan! 
HEAD SKETCH REWARD
Legendary Batman artist Graham Nolan will create a one-of-a-kind head sketch of one of your favorite characters – just for you. Receive a beautiful, inked head sketch that measures 5 inches by 8 inches that any Nolan fan would be proud to display.
This reward also includes hardcover copies of both Creator Edition Monster Island, and Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan, plus a digital copy of Monster Island. Shipping costs to be calculated when the campaign ends.
Graham Nolan Head Sketch examples.
 TORSO SKETCH REWARD
The co-creator of Bane will create a gorgeous torso sketch of a character you love fully inked, that measures 9 inches by 12 inches on Bristol. This beautiful sketch by Graham can be yours at the $230 reward level.
This reward also includes hardcover copies of both Creator Edition Monster Island, and Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan, plus a digital copy of Monster Island. Shipping costs to be calculated when the campaign ends.
Graham Nolan Torso Sketch examples.
 MONSTER DRAWING REWARD
The master monster maker of Monster Island, Graham Nolan, has created 10 unique monsters, each monstrously crafted in black ink on stark, white Bristol. Each grotesque creature illustration measures 9 inches by 12 inches and can be yours with a pledge at the $300 reward level.
This reward also includes hardcover copies of both Creator Edition Monster Island, and Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan, plus a digital copy of Monster Island. Shipping costs to be calculated when the campaign ends.
Graham Nolan Monster Drawing examples.
 STRETCH GOALS
Monster pin-up by Butch Guice!
Butch Guice is a superstar comic book artist that has worked for every major comic book publisher on such blockbuster titles as X-Factor, Adventures of Superman, Action Comics, Captain America, and many, many more! Butch created a gorgeous image featuring Monster Island’s Mac and Duke racing to escape a hideous monster’s clutches! Painted color by Nanjan Jamberi… feast your eyes!

Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of work on Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan and Monster Island 20th Anniversary Creator Edition is already complete. All art is in hand, meaning that only the editing, production, and printing phases of the project remain. Editing and production are already in process, and are expected to be complete by the time the Kickstarter campaign ends.

Assuming we are successfully funded, both books will be sent to press shortly after the campaign's conclusion. Proofing, printing, and shipping to our offices will take a few weeks, and then fulfillment can begin. Delays due to unforeseen circumstances are always possible, but we anticipate a smooth process and on-time delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The Black Hand is closing! We have only a few days left for BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2 on Kickstarter campaign! BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League is deluxe, hardcover graphic novel by the original creative team of Paul Harding, Ron Marz, and Matthew Dow Smith, an exciting horror espionage saga!
https://bit.ly/beastsoftheblackhand

We here at Ominous Press and Creation.Ink hope that you are safe and healthy in this challenging time.
We wanted to make you aware of an exciting project from a Friend of Ominous that is currently crowdfunding his newest graphic novel. You likely know writer/artist Graham Nolan from his legendary Batman work, including co-creating famed Bat-villain Bane, as well his two Ominous Press hardcover adventures, Monster Island and Return to Monster Island.
Graham’s latest project is a spine-chilling horror comic called THE CHENOO. Set in Buffalo (home to Ominous Press and Creation.Ink!), the terrifying tale reveals what happened during the the blizzard of 1977, when the blood-thirsty creature known as Chenoo came stalking out of the snow. Now in the present day, as another blizzard descends, the horror is happening all over again! Written and drawn by Graham Nolan, is classic horror by a classic creator!

Hello, Monster Maniacs! We’re thrilled to tell you that shipping for Graham Nolan’s Monster Island 20th Anniversary Creator Edition and Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan is complete! Everyone should received their rewards in the mail soon! A typical wait for someone in the states is around seven to 10 business days, with international shipping taking closer to 14-21 business days to arrive. 
But that’s not all! We’re also elated to announce that Graham Nolan’s Return to Monster Island is launching on Kickstarter on Tuesday, March 12! The campaign is going to feature the long-awaited sequel graphic novel to Monster Island, as well as the first full-color edition of the original ! We’ll also have loads of original art, some ultra-limited comics, and other epic surprises! We’re in the process of putting the campaign together now. You can click this link to follow our progress as we get closer to launch.
Good morning, Monster Maniacs! Graham Nolan’s Monster Island 20th Anniversary Creator Edition has arrived!
Ghouls and dolls, we are pleased to announce that Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan has arrived!

Hello, Monster Maniacs! We got some monstrously great news from our printer this morning! The beautiful hardcover Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan has been printed and is on a truck, headed to our offices now! Monster Island has also been printed, and is now in the binding stage. A separate binding facility had to be hired, due to the large size of the volume. Once binding is complete, Monster Island will also be shipped to us. As soon as we’ve got both books in hand, we’ll start fulfillment, and get your books on the way to you! Original art rewards have all been completed by Graham, and will ship with your books.

Monsters mavens of all shapes and sizes, your time has come! Your BackerKit surveys have been emailed, and should be reaching you today!
Please keep an eye on your inbox (and don’t forget to check your spam folder), as you’ll need to fill out your surveys to get your monstrously awesome rewards. The survey is also your chance to add additional rewards to your order.

campaign.story:
As "Avengers: Infinity War" dominates the worldwide box office, the legendary Jim Starlin, creator of Thanos, the Infinity Gauntlet, Drax, Gamora, and many more, is joining with Ominous Press to release two exciting projects!

Ominous Press is proud to present the Jim Starlin Collection.
Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin & Mindgames: A Hardcore Station Story

The first is Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin, a new collection of Starlin artwork, most of it never published previously. The 112-page hardcover spans Starlin's entire career, including classic images, rare private commissions, personal work, never-before-published sequential pages, and even the world's first glimpse of a new Dreadstar story.

This is pure Starlin, in all its cosmic power and glory. The images contained in the Black Book are all hand-picked by Jim Starlin, who has written commentary throughout. The cover is brand new, and may well be the last image Starlin draws after an accident injured his drawing hand. 
The second project is an oversize hardcover edition of Jim Starlin's illustrated prose novella Mindgames, a science-fiction epic set on Hardcore Station.
In Mindgames, telepath Dr. Zareb Alter is in reality a former member of a notorious interstellar crime organization. Alter is pulled back into his dirty family business as he tries to solve a murder on Hardcore Station. Along the way, he must contend with a genetically-altered collection of power-enhanced psychopaths, as well as deviants of all kinds, if he intends to reach the heart of the mystery.
Starlin's expansive, lavish artwork for Mindgames will be reproduced in gray tones, as the acclaimed illustrator originally intended. The result is a graphic and narrative tour de force from a master storyteller.
Described by the creator himself as "Starlin-brand sci-fi and weirdness" and checking in at more than 100 pages, this is the only hardcover publication of this story. Mindgames is the beginning of a four-part Hardcore Station story cycle.

JIM STARLIN ART PORTFOLIO
Limited to only 250 copies, the Jim Starlin Art Portfolio can be had for a pledge of $95 or more. The portfolio contains five of Jim Starlin's most exquisite illustrations, printed on thick paper stock at 9 inches by 12 inches. We'll be revealing each of the five images over the duration of the campaign. The pledge level includes both physical and digital copies of Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and Mindgames.
Dreadstar print by Jim Starlin (1st of 5 prints)
Thanos & Captain Marvel print by Jim Starlin (2nd of 5 prints)
Mongul & Superman print by Jim Starlin (3rd of 5 prints)
Thor & Thanos Print by Jim Starlin (4th of 5 prints)
Early Thanos Print by Jim Starlin (5th of 5 prints)
Cosmic Odyssey #1-#4 Signed by Jim Starlin
JIM STARLIN COSMIC AUTOGRAPH REWARD
Written by Jim Starlin and drawn by Mike Mignola, COSMIC ODYSSEY is a seminal DC Comics saga, a four-issue Prestige Format series that is hailed as one of the pinnacles of cosmic storytelling. Sets of the complete COSMIC ODYSSEY mini-series, autographed by Jim Starlin, are available for a pledge of $200 or more. The pledge level includes both physical and digital copies Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and Mindgames.
Batman: The Cult #1-#4 Signed by Jim Starlin
 JIM STARLIN BAT-O-GRAPH REWARD
Perhaps the most acclaimed of the Jim Starlin-Bernie Wrightson collaborations, BATMAN: THE CULT is widely seen as a landmark tale of the Caped Crusader. Best known for his cosmic tales, Starlin was equally at home writing street-level tales of Batman, and in his close friend Bernie Wrightson, found the perfect artistic partner. Sets of the complete original four-issue Prestige mini-series, autographed by Jim Starlin, are available for a pledge of $200 or more. The pledge level includes both physical and digital copies of Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and Mindgames.
Silver Surfer Homecoming Signed by Jim Starlin
JIM STARLIN SILVER AUTOGRAPH REWARD
The Silver Surfer returns to Zenn-La in a harrowing and tragic tale, written by Jim Starlin and illustrated by Bill Reinhold. Pristine, unread copies of the oversize graphic novel, hand-signed by Jim Starlin are available for a pledge of $150 or more. This reward tier includes both physical and digital copies of Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and Mindgames.
JIM STARLIN LEGACY PROJECT
As part of the Jim Starlin Collection campaign, Ominous Press is excited to announce the Jim Starlin Legacy Project, featuring original art rewards from a host of the acclaimed comic artists to celebrate Jim's storied career. An accident last year injured Jim's drawing hand, leading him to devote himself to writing full time. So in order to make original art a part of this campaign, we have enlisted a slate of Jim's collaborators and admirers to execute pieces featuring Jim's creations and most well-known characters. We'll be offering one original per day as a reward tier, from creators like Phil Hester, Tom Raney, Rick Leonardi, Graham Nolan, Andy Smith, Darryl Banks, Paul Harding, and many more.

The rewards also include hardcover copies of Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and the illustrated novella Mindgames. All of these art pieces are one-of-a-kind originals, so when they're gone, they're gone. Check back each day for a new offering!


Bart Sears Dreadstar Original Art
From the creator of the Ominous Universe comes a celebration to the Master of the Cosmic. Bart Sears has beautifully illustrated a one-of-a-kind piece of art featuring Dreadstar and his vast cast of characters. This gorgeous piece is fully inked and measures 11 inches x 17 inches, making it a true showpiece for any collector’s wall. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Bart Sears Original Dreadstar Art - Part 1 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project (SOLD)
Andy Smith Thanos Original Art  
DC and Marvel artist Andy Smith, who served as inker for Jim Starlin on his recent Thanos graphic novels, penciled and inked this incredible piece featuring Starlin creations Thanos, his brother Starfox, and his daughter Gamora. The original measures a full 11 inches x 17 inches.  Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Thanos, Starfox, and Gamora by Andy Smith - Part 2 of Jim Starlin Legacy Project (SOLD)
Phil Hester OMAC Original Art
Legendary writer/artist Phil Hester, known for his acclaimed Green Arrow and Swamp Thing runs, as well as his catalog of brilliant creator-owned titles, has masterfully penciled this tribute to Jim Starlin’s OMAC! Offered at the $750 pledge tier, this piece measures a full 11 inches by 17 inches, brilliantly inked by Bruce McCorkindale. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.  
Phil Hester Original OMAC Art - Part 3 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Graham Nolan Original Captain Marvel Art
Longtime Batman artist Graham Nolan, creator of the villain Bane as well as the classic Monster Island series (coming soon from Ominous Press), has delivered a sublimely illustrated depiction of Jim Starlin’s creation Thanos in a battle for the ages with his longtime foe Captain Marvel. Graham’s inked art measures a full 11 inches by 17 inches, and will go to one lucky backer. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Graham Nolan's Original Captain Marvel Art - Part 4 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project (Sold)
Darryl Banks Original Thanos vs. Mongul Art!  
Acclaimed artist Darryl Banks, co-creator of Green Lantern Kyle Rayner along with Ominous Press Editor-in-Chief and Lead Writer Ron Marz, tackles two vile villains created by Jim Starlin. The latest addition to the Jim Starlin Legacy Project is a stunning work of art featuring Starlin’s signature creations Thanos and Mongul in a titanic tussle. Darryl made his Mongul mark by including the villain in some of his first Green Lantern issues, and drew Thanos in the landmark Green Lantern-Silver Surfer crossover. This inked artwork measures a full 11 inches by 17 inches, and obviously, is one of a kind. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Darryl Banks' Original Thanos Vs. Mongul - Part 5 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Jeff Johnson Original Adam Warlock Art
Jeff Johnson’s extensive credits include Marvel’s Wonder Man, DC’s Green Lantern with Ominous Press Editor-In-Chief and Lead Writer Ron Marz, among others. His variant cover for Demi-God #1 from Ominous Press was a stunner! Jeff has illustrated one of Jim Starlin’s signature characters, Adam Warlock, in this gorgeous inked piece. Jim took the reins on Adam Warlock in 1975 in Strange Tales #178, and his work forever changed not only the character, but the landscape of the Marvel’s Cosmic Universe. Jeff’s beautiful original measures 11 inches by 17 inches, and can be yours for a pledge of $750 or more. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Jeff Johnson's Adam Warlock Original Art - Part 6 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Paul Harding Original Joker Art
Renowned artist and sculptor Paul Harding makes no secret of his love for the Clown Prince of Crime, having drawn and sculpted the Joker to great acclaim. Paul has penciled and inked this truly terrifying vision of the Joker as he appeared in the landmark “Death in the Family” storyline, which was of course written by Jim Starlin. Paul’s bloody terrific piece measures a landscape 17 inches by 11 inches, and is available now for a pledge of $750. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Paul Harding's Joker Original Art - Part 7 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Sandy Jarrell Original Warlock Art
Sandy Jarrell, acclaimed artist on Batman ‘66 and DC’s Bombshell’s United has created an amazing piece of art inspired by Jim Starlin’s prolific work on Adam Warlock! Meticulously crafted, Sandy’s piece features an ensemble cast of Jim Starlin characters and creations including Adam Warlock, Pip The Troll, Matriarch, Gamora, and Magus! This one-of-a-kind original art measures 11 inches by 17 inches, and can be yours for a pledge of $750 or more. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Sandy Jarrell Original Warlock Art - Part 8 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Joe Staton Original Oedi Art
Cartoonist Joe Staton, best known for his decades of work on DC Comics characters like Batman, Green Lantern, The Huntress and Justice Society of America has created a beautiful piece featuring Vanth Dreadstar’s sidekick Oedi from Jim Starlin’s epic series Dreadstar! Oedi was actually named after a cat that Starlin had at the time he was creating the Dreadstar series. This one-of-a-kind inked original measures 11 inches by 17 inches, and can be yours for a pledge of $750 or more. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Oedi by Joe Staton - Part 9 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Project
Tom Raney Original Adam Warlock Art!
Tom Raney, Kubert School alum and artist extraordinaire, known for his work on Uncanny X-Men, Warlock and the Infinity Watch, and Ominous Press titles such as Dread Gods (available now from IDW), has illustrated a gorgeous piece featuring Adam Warlock. An artistic masterclass, Tom’s inked original measures 11 inches by 17 inches, and can be yours for a pledge of $750 or more. Shipping costs to be calculated when campaign ends.
Tom Raney's Adam Warlock - Part 10 of the Jim Starlin Legacy Collection (SOLD)
JIM STARLIN ORIGINAL ART REWARD
Here is your opportunity to own a truly unique piece of original artwork by Jim Starlin. The 13"-by-18" pencil-and-ink piece depicts Thanos battling the Incredible Hulk (with much the same outcome as seen in Avengers : Infinity War). Sean HusVar of Ominous Press is donating this sought-after piece to the campaign.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The vast majority of work on Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin and Mindgames is already complete. All art is in hand, meaning that only the editing, production, and printing phases of the project remain. Editing and production are already in process, and are expected to be complete by the time the Kickstarter campaign ends. 

Assuming we are successfully funded, both books will be sent to press shortly after the campaign's conclusion. Proofing, printing, and shipping to our offices will take a few weeks, and then fulfillment can begin. Delays due to unforeseen circumstances are always possible, but we anticipate a smooth process and on-time delivery.

updates.update_userinfo: Drawing: As Taught by Bart Sears
updates.update_content: Comrades, as some of you may know, Bart Sears recently launched his Kickstarter for Drawing Powerful Heroes: Brutes and Babes Volume 2, and today is the last day to get in on the action!

Hello, cosmic comrades! So pleased to see that you’re all getting your rewards and loving them! We wanted to update you all on some awesome opportunities to meet the cosmic master, Jim Starlin, and chat with him in person about Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin. 
Here’s a list of shows Jim will be attending this year. If you’re a Hawaii native, or you’re there on holiday this weekend, you’re in for a treat!
Good afternoon, everyone! We’re excited to have been informed that some of you have already received Jim Starlin rewards, and are loving them as much as we do!

Good morning, Cosmic Comrades! We’re pleased to announce that the snow has subsided, our fulfillment team is back to work, and shipping for Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin has begun!
As we’ve mentioned previously, shipping will be coming out in batches. As of now, nearly 200 packages have been shipped with more going out the door each day until each and every one of you have your rewards, including the Jim Starlin Art Portfolio, any original artwork, signed comics, and maybe even a surprise or two! Remember, we can’t ship to you unless you have filled out your BackerKit survey. If you’re unsure if you’ve filled out your survey, you can simply login to your BackerKit account and check on your status. You can fill out your survey directly from BackerKit if you have not already done so.

Hello, from snowy Buffalo! We’re here with a bit of unfortunate news. Due to the snow storms and extreme cold that has slammed our area, shipping for Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin has been delayed. Members of our fulfillment team were not able to navigate to our office for a few days, as a number of area roads were shut down.

Greetings from the cosmos!  Recently, we’ve received a number of inquiries about the shipping of Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin. Many of you have requested an update, and we’re listening.
We’re happy to formally announce that packages will go into the mail next week. Since our last update, our fulfillment team has been hard at work, carefully crafting each of your packages and checking them for quality. Since we had so many amazing backers, we thought it best to be thorough, and not leave anything to chance.

Cosmic comrades, we have excellent news to share! The physical copies of both Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin have arrived at our Buffalo, NY offices! We’re thrilled with how both books came out.

Good morning, backers! We hope you’re enjoying your digital rewards! Though if we do say so, the physical copies of Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin are things of beauty. Those things of beauty are on a truck right now, heading to our offices, along with copies of Black Book: The Art of Graham Nolan, for those of you who backed that project.
As soon as the truck arrives (within the next week, pending Christmas), we’ll unload all 350 cases of books, and immediately start the fulfillment process. We’ll be back with photos of the books as soon as we get them unpacked!

Hello, cosmic comrades! Today, we’re happy to let you know that digital copies of Mindgames and Black Book: The Art of Jim Starlin have been delivered to your inboxes. Your digital copies can be accessed by using the code we’ve provided. You’ll find the code in your download instructions. We hope you love them as much as we do! If you do not have an email from us, please check your spam folder to make sure it did not get shunted there.
As for your physical rewards, we’ve been in contact with our printer every step of the way during this campaign. We’re working closely with the printer to expedite shipping to our storage and fulfillment facility, and we expect delivery of the books in the next few days, keeping in mind that the Christmas holiday falling on Tuesday will impact delivery. From the physical proofs we have seen, we expect both volumes have printed beautifully.

campaign.story:
“Night of Nights” Airborne Salute by Billy Tucci, Colors by Bill Farmer
“Soldiers of the Regiment, Tonight, is the Night, of Nights!”
74 years ago, 13,000 US and 8,000 British Paratroopers would drop into Normandy and carry out impossible tasks for any ordinary man. These heroes overpowered, surprised, and weakened the hundreds of thousands of German forces in the area so the troops landing on the beaches the following morning could take a foothold in the coast. The British 6th Airborne would land at Pegasus Bridge, the first place to be liberated in France, whereas the 101st Airborne and the 82nd Airborne would land in areas such as Saint Mere Eglise and Saint Come du Mont. But their victory came at a terrible prices as thousands were killed or missing, many caught in trees with their boots dangling mere feet from the land they traveled  so far to liberate. Loaded down with almost 200 pounds of equipment and jumping into a flak and machine-gun filled sky is a mohawked, war-painted member of Jake McNiece's Demolition Platoon 3/506th PIR aka. "The Filthy Thirteen." This image honors those true heroes who were the inspiration of the book and film, "The Dirty Dozen."  Remember these brave sky soldiers and those heroes who hold up that honorable legacy to this day, for they are the rough ones who stand ready so we may sleep peacefully in our beds at night.
And such were my thoughts when I illustrated “Night of Nights.” 
In my 20 plus years in the comic book business, this is one of my very favorite pieces.  So I was incensed to learn of a faceless entity trying to pirate this image, somewhere in China, on mass produced apparel.  After rallying our own “troops” and succeeding in thwarting their efforts, it became clear to me that the best way to protect this image from such piracy was to produce items featuring this special image ourselves, here in the good ol’ U S of A, while at the same time paying homage to the brave Airborne of WWII!!
Hoodies and T-shirts
Printed garment to be cut and sewn - Made in America!
VET TIX
Teaming up with our friends at Vet Tix was the next step, as they could help us facilitate the production of apparel, while we offered them a venue to spread awareness of the great things they do to honor and help any and all US veterans.  Crusade and Vet Tix have been partnered together on previous projects, and your pledges will help us further support them!!  We are always looking for ways to help honor our Veterens and current Military.
Now we need your support to make it happen!  With your help and pledges, we can manufacture a quality, American-made, line of T-shirt’s, Hoodies, and accessories that will provide awareness and support of all our veterans, especially that of our greatest generation.  At the same time, you will be helping us protect our art from copyright piracy off shore! 
$24,000 STRETCH GOAL - Vinyl Car Sticker will be included with all pledge levels of $20 or more!

Rewards and Pledge Levels
As you review our pledges rewards, feel free to contact us to make your own custom level, if you don’t see one that suits your needs.  We’ll work out an individual pledge amount that combines items and consolidates shipping, just for you. Send us a message through Kickstarter and we'll take care of it with you!

support.title: Curahee- Billy Tucci Remarked Edition
support.descp:
Billy Tucci’s “Airborne Salute” graces the cover of World War II Hero-Donald R. Burgett’s astonishing memoir that vividly portrays the tragic chaos of war: the blood and sweat, the glory and tears of one of the greatest battles of all time. “Currahee!” (this was the battle cry and motto of his regiment) begins with jump training and explodes in drama as they are parachuted into Normandy with orders to take and hold the high ground behind the beaches. “Currahee!” is the only book on World War II that General Dwight D. Eisenhower ever endorsed, calling it "a fascinating tale of personal combat" that "portrays the courage, endurance, initiative and fighting qualities of an American soldier on a European battlefield of World War II." Currahee! was originally published to critical acclaim in 1967. Donald R. Burgett holds the title of being the first enlisted man to write and publish on the Airborne.
Remarked Editions will be signed and will include a hand sketched remark by Billy Tucci on the inside cover.

support.title: HARLEY QUINN ORIGINAL COMIC ART PAGE!
support.descp:
HARLEY QUINN DC COMICS ORIGINAL PUBLISHED PAGE By Billy Tucci!
American Crusade Apparel is proud to announce a new Reward Level for an ORIGINAL ART PAGE from "Harley's Little Black Book"! The 11" X 17" illustration on DC Comics' Art Board was a pen/inked and washed comic book page from "HLBB #4" written by Jimmy Palmiotti and Amanda Conner with art by Tucci and colors by Paul Mounts. Billy rarely sells his artwork (especially Harley) so this is truly unique and a one-of-a-kind reward! The dynamic six-paneled page featuring not only Harley Quinn but also BOMBSHELL CATWOMAN, BIG BARTA, BATWOMAN and ZATANNA taking the fight straight to the Nazis is also laced with a ton of hidden details and humor, In the book, Harley beats the hell out of Hitler and the Bombshells secure victory for the Allies!
$600

support.title: "SGT. ROCK" ORIGINAL ARTWORK
support.descp: One of the most memorable Original "battle encompassing pages" from DC Comics award-winning "Sgt. Rock - The Lost Battalion" by Billy Tucci. Billy rarely sells his artwork, and this piece showcasing the desperate battle in the Vosges Mountains depicts the surrounded Rock and Easy Company fighting for their lives against the Germans. Billy himself is in this image as the non-combatant War Correspondent "Kilroy" about to be bayoneted by a German Gebirgsjäger. The 17" X 22" double page spread pays incredible and accurate attention to detail in regards to all aspects of the battle from weapons and gear to uniforms. A true unique and one-of-a-kind reward!

campaign.story:
PUNK TACO!
Punk Taco is an all-ages fun, whimsical, story about a teenage space taco and his unusual band mates who rock out across the galaxy and go on all kinds of crazy adventures. Punk Taco is all about peace and love and spreading it across the galaxy. Along the way he is met with obstacles he has to overcome but he embraces the challenge and a positive uplifting message is learned. 
In this first chapter Punk Taco befriends a young refugee that has been separated from his family and escapes detention. The young alien is lost and starving and finds an unlikely friend in Punk Taco who vows to help reunite him with his family. From there, Punk Taco is kidnapped by another alien race that is desperate for his secret intergalactic-famous Nacho recipe to save them from an evil tyrant that is hell-bent on dominating the galaxy. Did I mention that this is one wacky fun story?
The story is told in a sequential art format for those who love comic books but the product will be published as a hardcover children's book to give it a solid durable feel that both kids and adults enjoy. This will also make it easier for libraries to order copies and get them into the hands of kids in schools across the country.
Punk Taco was created, written and designed by myself and my 5 year old son. I am inking, coloring, lettering and designing the book as well with pencil assists by the super talented Gabriel Mayorga.
We are currently in the process of inking and coloring the book and will be  finished with the art in March.
I am looking to raise $4,000.00  to cover the cost of production (Inking, coloring, lettering, editing and design) printing, and shipping. Any extra money will be put into adding more pages of story/art and making the book even more awesome.
I am not offering a lot of rewards outside of autographed copies, sketches and original art because I want to focus all my time on finishing the book. 
I don't want to give too much away but here are a few  pages of pencil art before they are colored and lettered. I'm going to update this page as much as possible to show you what we are working on. Stay tuned.
Punk Taco Sample Pages
     Recent Interviews
BleedingCool.com: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2017/02/18/creating-comics-kids-kids-punk-taco-galactic-champion-peace/
So Wizard Podcast: http://sowizardpodcast.com/episode-132-legion-premiere-reviewreaction/
Pop Culture Pipe Bomb: http://www.popculturepipebomb.com/exclusive-interview-with-punk-taco-creator-adam-wallenta/
STRETCH GOALS!
If we raise $5,000.00 I will add a new bonus 10-page story to the book.
If we raise $6,0000.00 I will add a new bonus 20-page story to the book.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risk is if we don't get funded it will take longer to publish this awesomely fun story. You won't lose a dime though. When we do get funded the book will be completed asap and in your hands as soon as it is printed. I've had several successful projects funded on Kickstarter and all my supporters are always very happy. I've published dozens of my own books in the past in the days before crowd funding and I know exactly how to deliver a high quality product.

updates.update_content:
Dear Friends and Supporters,
I hope this finds you and yours all safe and healthy and managing well during these uncertain times.
I have been busy working on Punk Taco 2 while taking care of the kids an preparing the new school year at home. This new reality has slowed down my production considerably and I apologize, but I promise you we are working hard to get the new book done.

Hello Friends and Supporters!
I hope you are all staying safe and healthy and maintaining your sanity in this new world of ours. I've been meaning to post an update but, while working from home is nothing new for me, it is a new experience to have the family home at the same time 24/7. So my productivity has really slowed down and I apologize. But we are working hard on completing PUNK TACO 2 and I even have 9 pages of Volume 3 penciled.
In the meantime, my friend and I have put together this PUNK TACO Vol 1 read along for you and hope you will share it with all the young people and young at heart in your lives. We want to encourage librarians, teachers and everyone you know to watch and hopefully enjoy. Please share the video on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and all across social media.

They also make great holiday gifts. http://a.co/d/73dPoav

I just wanted to share this image with you and let you know next month sometime we will be launching the official Kickstarter campaign to raise funds for volume 2. Hello Friends and Supporters,

Angel and the World Enders is the next up and coming title from POND SCUM comics label coming to a comic book store near you.It follows the life of a girl named Angel, who for reasons unknown, was sent away from her family on the planet Chronus at a very young age. After crash landing on the planet Indo and being mentored by a master battle mechanic named Justice. Her life is interrupted by a familiar culture with a history of destroying civilizations.
Angel cover art
 Every dollar donated will go directly to the production of this one of a kind comic experience. First, the very talented Mike Oppenheimer is our artist working on this project and as I'm sure everyone knows. Great artists don't come cheap! Second, along with paying for our awesome artist, the donations will be put toward professional lettering done by the also talented HDE. His work can be seen in many other indie titles as well as my other creative work "The Infected". Finally, the donations will be put towards print copies of Angel and the World Enders. Again, everything costs money and it seems to add up quickly so thank you for your support. Without you this comic wouldn't be possible.
Michael Oppenheimer 11X17 PRINT
Above, you can see a pic of the very awesome 11x17 print created by artist Mike Oppenheimer that can be yours with just a 20$ donation.The below art gives you an idea of what to expect as you turn each inside page of issue #1. From the gripping story, amazing art, or the professional lettering. You wont be disappointed with this one.
  INSIDE PAGE
 Growing up on an alien planet with a huge mechanical arm can be tough at times. Lucky for her, Angel is tough as nails and doesn't take crap from anyone.
INSIDE PAGE
  Digital Rewards
  Charity Buhain aka Cari Dee 11x17 print
Thank you for taking the time to check out my kickstarter. I'm really proud of where this project is heading and hope to have you be a part of it. Even if you can't donate. Just spreading the word, telling a friend, or sharing the link helps us get one step closer to completing our project. Thanks again.

As soon as the kickstarter completes Mike will get start hammering out pages. There should be no issues having a completed first issue done by May of this year but if an issue does come up, I will keep all fans in the know with details of the problem and how I plan on fixing it.

campaign.story:
The Living Corpse: Relics
The Living Corpse rises from the grave in an all new 160+ page original graphic novel by the Corpse Crew- Ken Haeser, Buz Hasson and Blair Smith. It's also the 10th anniversary of The Living Corpse so we're bringing you the biggest LC story yet!
Corpse Crew Ken, Blair and Buz
Who is The Living Corpse?
Once he was a mindless zombie, but now he is The Living Corpse, protector of the border between the world of the living and the realm of the dead!
The Living Corpse
What is Living Corpse: Relics about?
The Living Corpse: Relics picks up after the events of Living Corpse: Exhumed. Don't remember what happened? Grab a bundle that includes digital versions of the entire LC library!
After the events of The Living Corpse: Exhumed, our undead hero has left his job as the Gatekeeper between the world of the living and the monsters that live in the shadows. Now living in a Monsterary in Tibet, The Living Corpse is called back into action when an ancient evil with ties to the Living Corpse’s past rises from the tombs of ancient Egypt.
Also, the young Vampire, Lilith goes on a search for her fellow Nosferatu to see if she is truly the last of her kind. And she might just regret that decision.
All of this as well as we learn more about Asteroth’s ties to the Gatekeepers and we find out exactly how John Romero died!
This is the biggest, most epic Living Corpse tale that is not to be missed.
What the hell am I buying?
The Living Corpse: Relics is a 160+ page original graphic novel that contains a brand new Living Corpse story as well as a ton of behind the scenes material like scripts, character designs and tons of great pin-ups from a bunch of kick ass artists. Plus we've got a ton of great extra rewards available nowhere else!
Living Corpse Relics trade cover
 Sketch covers
We've got two versions of the sketch cover to offer. The first is the regular black and white sketch cover sketched and signed by Ken, Buz and Blair. And we are also offering up a high end artist editon Living Corpse Relics sketch cover featuring a full color cover by all three of the Corpse Crew- Ken Buz and Blair.

Why a Kickstarter?
The Living Corpse is a creator owned book. That means that we don't make any money till after the book comes out. TLC: Relics is about 75% done and the kickstater will help us pay the bills while we finish up the rest of the book and to pay for printing.

I thought you guys were going to do a 6 issue mini series for TLC Relics?
That was the original plan but in this age of binging whole seasons on Netlix, we decided to give you the whole thing all at once. What, did you really want to wait 6 months for the story to unfold? Didn't think so.
What about rewards?
Glad you asked! We've got tons of great rewards for those who back the project from stickers to high end, one of a kind Living Corpse merch. Check em out!
Original Artwork UPDATE!
We just added a bunch of original artwork packages to the Kickstarter! Check it out:

campaign.story:
Thieves' Guild or Elven Treehouse? Magic Shop or Dwarven Tavern? In Unreal Estate, the City Council has hired you to build the best cityscape, which you'll do by drafting buildings to your hand. Rejected designs go to the Scrap Pile, but as demand for those buildings grows, you can reclaim them to score the most points. But be careful that the other architects don't score them before you!
Designed by Jason Slingerland (cohost of Building the Game podcast and designer of Water Balloon Washout), with art by the talented Corinne Roberts, Unreal Estate is a game of drafting, hand management, and timing set in a fictional fantasy city. It is a game for 2-4 players, and only takes about 20 minutes to play.
During Unreal Estate's development, playtesters consistently commented that they enjoyed the simple mechanics combined with real decisions on every turn. Players never felt as though they were playing on autopilot, and a turn was always made with consideration of other players' actions – all in a 20-minute game. Check out the amazing art and the print-and-play files to see how Unreal Estate pulls it off.
                PLAY

If you want to check out the rules for Unreal Estate, or print out the game and try it for yourself, download the print-and-play files right here! 
Achieving our base funding goal will ensure that Grand Gamers Guild will be able to publish Unreal Estate with high quality that you expect.
Here is a list of all unlocked stretch goals that will allow us to upgrade components and help us add more cards, better bits, and even prettier components!
  Unreal Estate is a hit! Find out what many board game reviewers, insiders, and designers are saying about the game.
                                         Have you played Unreal Estate and want to tell everyone how much you enjoyed it? Join the discussion here on Kickstarter and please share on BoardGameGeek!
Unreal Estate is available for world-wide shipping and all copies will ship from within the US. Shipping fees will be added to your pledge level when you select your location. Shipping costs to specific locations are shown on each pledge level.
We know that international shipping can be a pain, so check out our 5 copy pledge level to save on shipping for groups!
Note: International Backers will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package. However, this campaign is customs friendly for the $25 level and below. The low price point for this game should not cause any customs fees for backers pledging for 1 copy. We all know that shipping can be costly, so we are doing our absolute best to keep shipping costs low and fair. We appreciate your understanding and support!
 
Marc Specter is the Master of the Grand Gamers Guild. He is also an owner of GrandCon Gaming Convention and Headmaster of the Grand Gaming Academy demo team.
Jason Slingerland is cohost of the Building the Game podcast and self-published Water Balloon Washout.
Corinne Roberts realized our building ideas in traditional watercolor art. All prints of her work for sale can be found here.
Chris Kirkman is the Graphic Designer for Unreal Estate. He is also the founder of Dice Hate Me Games, voice of the State of Games Podcast, and co-designer of the upcoming Fate of the Elder Gods.
The project video was created by Jason Slingerland and Rob Couch. The How-to-Play narration was provided by Jason Slingerland. Music by Kevin MacLeod.
Kickstarter is an interesting landscape, very different from 2010 when Alien Frontiers broke the scene open for the board gaming world. For many it has turned into a pre-order system, and the notion of being a patron – of supporting a creator and helping see his/her vision to fruition – often no longer seems to be the central focus for many. 
This is my first project, and some may question, "Can he really make this happen with only a $5,000 goal?" I chose that goal because I believe I should put at least as much into this project as you, my supporters, do. It will take more than $5,000 to see this dream come true, but my part is ready. If you are willing to embrace the Guild by lending us your support, we really do appreciate it. Thank you for looking at our project, and considering bringing to life our collective vision.
Sincerely,
Marc Specter
  If you want to be kept updated and have a chance to win a copy of Unreal Estate, visit grandgamersguild.com and sign up for our mailing list.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project that involves the production and manufacture of a good to be delivered, there is certainly a real chance for hiccups and delays. Many boardgame projects on Kickstarter have been seriously hampered by art production delays, problems with an overseas factory, missing units and one shipping snafu after another.

Even though this is Grand Gamers Guild's first project, our team has a wealth of experience in the production process.

We won't lie - stuff happens. Delays can occur. Sometimes you have to go back and forth on color samples six times just to get the color right, and even then the color isn't perfect. But what we do promise is that we will hold ourselves to the same high standards we expect from other board game publishers and our previous projects, and we will be completely honest and open with each of you every step of the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
