updates.update_userinfo: Returning to where it all began
updates.update_content:
Over a year ago, after UKGE, I was sitting in an airport with Isaac Shalev, co-designer of Seikatsu, among other titles. Isaac has been a friend for many years, one of the rotating hosts of On Board Games, and vocal fan of Unreal Estate.
We began discussing how Unreal Estate might be reimagined, and then we, dare I say, began designing! Eventually our boarding calls sounded, and we parted with words that went something like this, "Isaac, I really  like what we've laid down here. If you want to reach out to Jason and set another game in the Unreal Estate world, I'd be very interested."
Endangered needs your support!
Citizens of Guildmore, we come to you with a proclamation from the Mayor: today is Shikoku Day!
Citizens of Guildmore! It's been a while. I wanted to reach out briefly and let you know that we just launched our next game on Kickstarter: The Artemis Project.

To you that have supported us previously, we go live at 9 tomorrow morning. Feel free to check out the video and the campaign. We hope to see you there: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/burntislandgames/1508813296?ref=433593&token=de981c5c

Today ends the voting for the BGG Most Anticipated Games of 2018 nominations. If you’ve not already given a thumb to our next project Endeavor, please do: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/231943/item/5764955#item5764955
If you want to find out more about the progress of the project, visit endeavorgame.com. Thanks!

Kickstarter sent me an email letting me know that it was one year ago today that Unreal Estate funded.
So much has happened since funding, and coincidentally today is the day I leave to attend Essen, another noteworthy benchmark in Guild history.
It seemed a great time then to say “Thank you.” to all of you who jumped aboard this crazy dream.

Citizens of Guildmore! I hope you don't mind me sharing some company news, not specific to our beloved game. (If you are a subscriber to our e-mail newsletter you can hit delete.) We had some big things take place at Gen Con, so here goes:
The 'Sobel' prize
And the winner is...Grand Gamers Guild! We've been talking about Endangered (our upcoming cooperative dice placement game in which you'll be saving endangered species from extinction) for a while, and are THRILLED to let you know that we'll be working with for the art!

Happy birthday Jason!
Tomorrow is Unreal Estate Designer Jason Slingerland's birthday, and we've decided to run a special offer in our online store to celebrate! If you purchase Unreal Estate from our online store through August 8 at midnight EST, we'll send you Gothic Estate AND 1 set of promo Orphanage cards for free.
Citizens of Guildmore, I am delighted to announce that as of about 2 hours ago, ALL packages were delivered to the local USPS and are on their way!

Hello, I'm Tom Bancroft.  This Kickstarter project is so I can print my "Art of Tom Bancroft, Vol. 1" book and ship it to you.  
The Book
Specs are: 8.5"x 12", 52 pages, hardcover, with glossy, full color pages.
This is a simple project, but one I've been wanting to do for some time now.  It will feature mostly full page art illustrations by me and colored by industry professionals Jeremiah Skipper (most of them), but also by Joe Spadaford, me, Chuck Vollmer and Jesse Heagy. With some sketches sprinkled in there also.  Most of the content are fan drawings, commissions, or "for fun" drawings I've done over the last couple years.  A few might by favorites of mine from a little farther back than that.  I want this to feel like the "ultimate" Tom Bancroft art book.  If you've enjoyed my artwork on Instagram (tombancroft1), DeviantArt, or other places over the years, I think you'll like this book.
My background is character design and traditional animation- mostly with Disney Feature Animation.  I worked on many of the classic Disney films of the 90s (Beauty and the Beast, The Lion King, Aladdin, Tarzan, Mulan, and Brother Bear to name a few) but also worked on Veggietales, ABCMouse.com, and other properties for Marvel, DC, Archie comics and more.  In my 30 year career I've also illustrated many children's books, created comic books and worked on video games too.  You've seen little pieces of me all over the place and probably didn't know it.  Additionally, I've written two perennial art instruction books: "Creating Characters with Personality" and "Character Mentor" that are the #1 best selling books on the subject of Character Design and are used as text books at art schools around the world.  Much of those artistic influences will be in this book in some way. 
My goal is to keep this Kickstarter simple: It's about creating this book.  The artwork for the book is finished, the graphic design/page layout is already in process and the printer in China is Global PSD, whom I've worked with before on my Opposite Forces" graphic novel.  They do excellent work.  I do have some REWARD tiers for artwork that is either already in the book or might be if we reach a later Milestone goal, so that artwork is already completed, so you should have nothing to fear concerning this project not getting finished or being delayed.  
WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?  That's easy- about 70-75% goes to paying to get the books printed.  Another 15% goes to shipping supplies for the books (along with additional shipping costs in the Reward tiers themselves).  Lastly, about 8-10% is allocated for Kickstarter fees and about 3% for my graphic designer.  There is NOTHING in this for me besides a few left over books (I hope!) that I can sell at a later date.  IF we go beyond the asking amount, I hope to get some of my work/expenses/time paid for, but I do not expect it.  (My wife would like that though.)  I also hope to put some more of that back into the books by adding Milestone Goals (more pages!) as we go.  
Let's do this!  
Thank you for considering backing and supporting this Kickstarter!  I need you to help me make this book project a reality.  -Tom Bancroft

"Wednesday isn't just new comic day anymore; Eggleston's bounty hunter story about the woman Wednesday injects a little fun into a genre that takes itself too seriously anymore." -- Matt Hawkins, President and COO of Top Cow Productions
Dead by Wednesday #2 is the second comic in what we hope will be a series of books that follow the adventures of bounty hunter Wednesday Daring.

Wednesday's story, which is for mature readers, is set in the future when humankind has long since left the confines of Earth and branched out into the galaxy. Aliens are an everyday part of life, and humanity has found its place among them.

Wednesday Daring is a bounty hunter. She's young, she's fearless and she's damn good at what she does for a living -- although not always the most motivated. Our protagonist is a firm believer in the idea that the rigors of life should not stand in the way of a good time.

She is smart. She is sarcastic. She is beautiful. She is bold. Quite frankly, she's an absolute joy to write.

The comic we are asking you to Kickstart is a 24-page second issue that is the latter half of a two-part story arc. We are asking for enough money to cover the pencils, inks, colors, letters, printing and shipping of the book, as well as the creation and shipping of the rewards we have offered. Currently, we have all of the pages penciled and half inked. The first five pages, which you can see below, have been colored and lettered. 

Since everything is already penciled, and the inks will be done before the end of this Kickstarter campaign, we anticipate a quick turnaround and shipment of comics beginning this summer. We've stated August if only for the fact that we've hit some snags on the past couple of projects that delayed the shipping, but we are hoping to be done sooner than that. 
THE COMIC
Here are the two available covers: 
Dead by Wednesday #2 cover
Dead by Wednesday #2 variant cover

 THE CREATIVE TEAM
We are pretty proud of the creative team we have assembled for this particular comic.  
Sam Eggleston and Kim Eggleston, who hail from Michigan's Upper Peninsula, are sharing writing duties. Sam has written published comics such as Last Breath, Combat Jacks (with Mark McKenna), Cazadora (with Randy Kintz), The Eighth Day (with Roberta Ingranata) and contributed to the BOOnana Tail Halloween Special (with Mark McKenna). He has several other projects he is currently working on as well. This series marks Kim's first step into writing comics, though she has been a professional writer for the past seven years. She has previously edited Last Breath, The Eighth Day, Combat Jacks 2 and 3, and Cazadora and probably anything else you've seen Sam write.
Jay De Foy is a Michigan-based artist who has been working his way into comics for years. He has his own self-published title, Threadcount, which he successfully Kickstarted, and has previously done work for Zenescope, and, of course, Dead by Wednesday #1.  
John Hunt and Sam Eggleston have worked on several projects together, including Combat Jacks, Last Breath, The Eighth Day and Cazadora. Hunt has worked on various published properties as a colorist and letterer, like Naruto, Star Trek: The Next Generation and Grimm Fairy Tales. He will handle both colors and letters on Dead by Wednesday #2. 
REWARDS
First and foremost, I would like to say that I am sorry for the higher international shipping on this Kickstarter than I have charged in the past, but the last two rounds of international rewards for my campaigns have been insane in terms of price. This isn't meant to discourage international backers... just meant to cover the actual costs.

FULL TRANSPARENCY

campaign.story:
Throughout 2014 and 2015, line artist Jerry Ordway (Superman, Crisis, Captain Marvel), colourist Marissa Louise, and writer Alex de Campi (Archie v Predator, Grindhouse, No Mercy) serialised a modern, techno/Lovecraftian horror series in Dark Horse Presents. That series is now being collected into a 104-page softcover graphic novel, but in the meantime we've got another three Semiautomagic stories we would like to include in a special, expanded edition of that graphic novel: a box set including a second, 80-page softcover of new stories.
Semiautomagic follows the highs and lows (mostly lows) of occult investigator Alice Creed, an average girl from a bad part of town who ended up in the wrong place at the wrong time. A decade after the wrong turn that changed her life, she is who you call when magic ends up in murder. 
But the magic of Alice's world isn't the cozy, familiar magic of Vertigo books: no myths and legends, no Bast and Queen Mab here. Just the void, and inexplicable, incomprehensible things coming through from other dimensions, other colours of space. Magic itself is a thing with barely understandable rules and many, many unforeseen results. There is a strong element of J-horror, too: one of the ways that predators and parasites come through into our world is via technology, and via places that have some profound impact on our cultural consciousness -- NATO nuclear test sites, for example. This is modern horror, set in the strange nooks and crannies of America, the forgotten places of shadow in our nation. Stay weird, America.
a panel from Semiautomagic: The Bomb That Will Bring Us Together
Alice is a character that Alex and Jerry developed together, and Jerry was crucial in so many aspects, from her design, to story ideas, to pushing for Alice to be based in New England, an area very familiar to both of us. The book is very scary and very disturbing, but is technically PG. While there is body horror, it is not sexual in nature, nor is there excessive gore or indeed any nudity. To be fair, we didn't need to resort to cheap thrills in Semiautomagic. It's more a book of creeping, unsettling horror that stays with you long after you're done.
Read the first eight pages of our first Semiautomagic story below! It was published in Dark Horse Presents #4, in 2014.
The 104-page softcover is 100% complete. Of the new stories, all are written, and Jerry is well into drawing the longer of his two stories, "Childhood's End". Lara has begun work on her story, "A Town Called Malice". The series' original editor, Brendan Wright, has joined us on a freelance basis, and Dark Horse is handling design and printing because they have fabulous deals with their printers that we can't even imagine (this means you get a much better quality book, and we get a much lower print bill!).
Dark Horse will be releasing just the 104-page softcover in June. (It's in February Previews right now). They will NOT be selling the box set, or the 80-page new book. The new book is only available as part of the box set in this Kickstarter, and we're only planning to print 1,000 of them. Our box set should be ready to send to backers in August.
What you're getting:
Funding goal: $21,000
Printing, shipping, covers, kickstarter fees, plus art for "Childhood's End". 
*Book 1: 104-page softcover collection of Jerry, Alex, and Marissa's two Semiautomagic arcs in Dark Horse Presents: The Bomb That Brings Us Together and Throne of Blood. 
*Book 2: 28-page new Semiautomagic story, drawn by Jerry Ordway and coloured by Marissa Louise: "Childhood's End". Alice plunges into Seussian madness while investigating a Howard Hughes-esque recluse in a shuttered Maine mansion. See updates for Jerry's pages in progress!
*Hardcover case / box with cover by Jerry Ordway.
nb: printing, shipping and fees is most of this goal. Le sigh.
Stretch goal #1: $26,000
Art for "A Town Called Malice".
*Book 2 becomes 60 pages, adding a 32-page story drawn by Lara Margarida and coloured by Marissa Louise: "A Town Called Malice". Alice's friend Harriet, who is unstuck in time and falls into a different timestream every 24 hours, attempts to rescue a woman who made a wish while burning her wedding bouquet... and is now dealing with the horrifying consequences of that wish coming true. It's about what happens to manic pixie dreamgirls after they marry the damaged hero, and when the manic pixie-ness isn't enough any more to paper over that damage.
But why have Lara draw this and not Jerry? Lara is an amazing artist in her own right, and as this is a story about Harriet (not Alice, our usual main character) we thought it would be lovely to bring in a rising star alongside Jerry. Plus, with Jerry already providing almost 40 pages of new story, we wanted all three new stories to be drawn and the box set to be out within a reasonable time after the Dark Horse collection came out -- not practicable if we added another 32 pages to Jerry's workload. See updates for Lara's pages in progress! 
Stretch goal #2: $28,000
 Art for "The Hollow Man".
*Book 2 becomes 80 pages, adding a 12-page story drawn by Jerry Ordway and coloured by Marissa Louise: "The Hollow Man," as Alice goes to Los Angeles and finds out what is eating a famous actor. 
Stretch goal #2: $31,000
 A Tomer Hanuka cover.
*Hardcover case/box gets an exclusive Tomer Hanuka cover. Tomer Hanuka is a legendary Israeli illustrator who also provided the cover to Alex's Smoke/Ashes book, and Alex kinda has a thing about unifying design across her books. 
* * *
Original cover for debut instalment of Semiautomagic in Dark Horse Presents #4
I have questions! Course ya do, sunshine.
I love Jerry Ordway! Yeah, we do too :D. But I'm really sad you don't have more sketch or commission rewards! We don't have them because we love Jerry. He is already setting aside a massive chunk of time to draw the Semiautomagic pages, and frankly we don't want Kickstarter to eat his life. We also want any commission income to go straight to him. So, if you DO want a Jerry Ordway commission to go with your book, at his normal commission rates, please message us and we'll put you in touch to work that out directly with him!
Also where are the prints and posters and buttons and stuff? Do you dig those? For real? Because I've backed like 50 Kickstarter projects and all I really want is the darn book. I have whole drawers of cards and mini-prints and other kerfuffle that got sent along with the darn book that I just... ignore. But hey, you're the boss. If enough of you message us and are like "we will die if we all don't get buttons", heck, we'll do buttons.
But why isn't Dark Horse just publishing this? Why do you have to Kickstart? Everyone involved in this project has families, and does comics as their full-time career. That means it's pretty hard to be like "I'm just gonna take three months off getting paid and do some pages for fun". Alas, our mortgage companies don't take "exposure". And graphic novels just don't make enough money that Dark Horse can hand us $30k and be like, "sure, you crazy kids run along and write/draw more horror stories!". For example: we are likely to sell as many copies of Semiautomagic in this Kickstarter as Dark Horse will in the first month of the 104-page collection's release. We are so, so thrilled that Dark Horse is being supportive of us and is already helping us so much with design and by letting us leverage the agreements they have with their printers... let's not be greedy, shall we?
The first panel of Semiautomagic: Throne of Blood
Would you do more Semiautomagic stories after this? Heck yes. We have so many we want to do... but we're not cheap dates (we can't actually afford to live on the sort of indie-comic page rates projects like this usually get), and we're doing the book in an unfashionable format: short one- and two-issue stories that sometimes build into other things and sometimes don't, rather than six-issue arcs "for the trade" (and the option). I'm really hoping this Kickstarter is successful so we can come back and do another one for more new work after this... perhaps a "Semiautomagic Annual" that we could send separately? Oh the dreams we have! But let's get this baby funded first.
Are there zombies or vampires in Semiautomagic? No.
Why not hardcover editions? $$$$. Like, maybe if we hit all our stretch goals and then overfund, I'll upgrade everyone? But for us, more story content is a higher priority than hard covers. What do you think?
So what if you do crazy-overfund? Kinda just got a temptation to divide any overfunds around the entire creative team, rather than killing ourselves to do extra stuff. You don't make a lot of money in comics. We're all just scraping by, honestly, and a little bonus would be nice.
Why aren't you willing to suffer for your art? Because that's charming at 20 and truly tedious by 40.
Can I have just the new book? No. 
No points for guessing he's not a good guy.
How did you come up with the pricing for the books? (Cost of creation) / (Print Run) + (Error margin) = Book price. Yeah, we wish it was a bit cheaper too, but even with DH on our side, a box set print run for 180 pages of content ain't cheap.
I'm a retailer and I want to sell this set in my store. Do you have a retailer package? OKAY FINE I ADDED ONE JEEZ GUYS. Please bear in mind there is the $12.99 Dark Horse 104-pager (eg half our box set) that comes out in June, and our box set won't come out until August at earliest. 
Is this your first time at the rodeo? Oh, heck no. I raised $32,000 in the early days of Kickstarter for my graphic novel Ashes. It proved a far more challenging project than expected, and we did deliver 9 months late. Hopefully making up for that, we delivered twice the book we promised (it became a collected edition of Ashes and its 2005 prequel Smoke), in a better format than promised (cased hardbacks for everyone!), and with a more exciting lineup of artists than promised (Sienkiewicz! Doran! McNeil! Guéra!). And we turned around every book to ship to backers in less than a week after they arrived. So, when life gives you lemons, punch them so hard you shatter the space-time continuum. Or something.
SEMIAUTOMAGIC: OPENING 8 PAGES
(Originally printed in Dark Horse Presents #4. These are my old lettering copies, so the magenta dotted line and crop marks obvs aren't there in the final version. You can see Harriet, the lead in "A Town Called Malice", on page 8!)
Semiautomagic P.1
Semiautomagic p.2
Semiautomagic p.3
Semiautomagic p.4
Semiautomagic p.5
Semiautomagic p.6
Semiautomagic p.7
Semiautomagic p.8
 THE TEAM!
Alex de Campi is an Eisner-nominated comics writer. Her recent books No Mercy and Archie vs Predator have achieved both critical and commercial success, and her Grindhouse series at Dark Horse started the recent revival of exploitation-cinema comic books. Valentine, her groundbreaking fantasy-thriller digital comic with Christine Larsen, is widely credited as having established the digital-native storytelling techniques used by the flood of later digital-native graphic stories It's also been downloaded over half a million times. Alex lives in Northern New England with her daughter and a pair of rescue dogs.
Jerry Ordway is a legendary comics artist and writer, known mostly for his work at DC. He has famous runs on Superman, Crisis on Infinite Earths, and Captain Marvel. He can draw anything, from the sweetest and most romantic Superman / Lois portrait to the most visceral horror. He lives in New England with his family.
Marissa Louise is a Portland-based illustrator, colourist and thinker who has brought her dazzling and modern touch to Semiautomagic from the beginning.
Lara Margarida is a comics and storyboard artist based in the UK. We all love her and she's gonna be the next big thing. You heard it here first.
Brendan Wright is a freelance editor with nearly a decade of experience in in the field, between Dark Horse Comics, Top Shelf Productions, and independent projects. He was the original, developing editor on Semiautomagic. He is based in Portland.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with this project is it being late. Though one book (the 104-page Dark Horse Presents collection of Semiautomagic) is already complete and Jerry and Lara have already started on their pages for the 80-page second book, it is never beyond the realms of possibility that an artist could have something come up in their life that means a deadline needs to be missed.

We have a pretty good infrastructure in place to manage this: the series' original editor Brendan Wright is riding shotgun on everyone; we have Dark Horse itself managing the design and printing; and lord knows I've successfully managed and delivered on a comics Kickstarter before where a lot of unexpected issues came up. (Unlike Ashes, however, this project is: smaller, far more substantially complete, and involves a team I already know well and trust. In other words, maybe I learned my lesson.) 

I also feel that the experience of Ashes taught me that backers should be able to ask for refunds at any time up until the book is in the mail, if they are unhappy with the way the project is going or any delays in it. Although we do not expect delays, I really loved the "anytime refund" policy we had at Ashes and will continue it with Semiautomagic.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This KICKSTARTER campaign is aimed at funding the TRADE PAPERBACK compilation of the first four issues of NEW ZODIAX, which introduce you, the reader, to the New AQUARIUS, the New PISCES, the New LEO and the New SAGITTARIUS. This is a shared epic;  the NEW ZODIAX characters will interact with one another in future storylines. Decisions one character has made will affect the life of another. FIRST STRETCH GOAL!
First off, thank you so much for the support. The response has been tremendous and we're excited to bring The Argonauts to print. We've still got a lot of time and we want to start adding some stretch goals, so here's the first!
 Look, son! A Kickstarter campaign!
TJ Comics is relaunching our campaign to collect The Argonauts issues 1-6 in trade paperback form. (144 pages of story)
What is The Argonauts?
The Argonauts — co-created by writer and Harvey Award Nominee Keith Dallas and artist Robert Saunders—features eight principal characters from different time periods (specifically the Norwegian Middle Ages and the outer rim of the galaxy in the 27th century) who are brought together by an unknown force right before an evil alien race threatens to enslave humanity in modern day America.
READ THE ENTIRE FIRST ISSUE HERE
What makes this book different?
Well, in order to stop the invasion, the heroes will have to overcome the language barriers that keep them from understanding each other. That's right - they don't all speak English! There are no universal translators like Star Trek and it's not a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away where everyone conveniently understands each other. The Argonauts places these heroes in a unique conundrum in order to save humanity. Plus, one is a Norwegian Mountain Giant.
Let's look at the simple, not at all complicated Rewards.
Who is The Argonauts for?
It's for YOU!
More specifically, The Argonauts is for anyone who likes a thrilling, action-packed adventure with intriguing character interaction. Since none of the violence is gory, and all profanity is censored, The Argonauts is appropriate for anyone who can watch a PG-13 movie.
Why Kickstarter? Didn't you try this already?
Kickstarter is the most practical method for funding independent print runs (which ain’t cheap). We did run basically the same campaign last year albeit unsuccessfully. However, we really believe in this book and we know readers will enjoy it. And as much as a success as Patriot-1 has been for TJ Comics, we've learned a few things along the way.
Where is the money going?
Into the print run, shipping fees, Kickstarter fees and Amazon fees.The production of the book is finished. Any leftover funds will go directly into the production of the next Argonauts book.

$6000 STRETCH GOAL - A Brand New, EXTRA Story Page (Graphic Novel ONLY)!
TWO Stretch Goals ACHIEVED:
UNIQUE Amanda Rachels Pencil Sketch Card for ALL Print Reward Backers! (100 Backer Stretch Reward)
6.5" x 10" Vicious Circus Single-Issue Covers Print for ALL Print Reward Backers! ($5500 Stretch Reward)
Vicious Circus NOW Available in Single Issues, if You Prefer:
Four Single-Issue VICIOUS CIRCUS Comics (Beginning at the $30 Reward Tier OR ADD to Existing Pledge for Just $25) - Each With EXCLUSIVE COVER ART - For Those Who Prefer or Want to Collect Them!
THE STORY
Vicious Circus is a 104-page horror graphic novel – the story of a tiny, country municipality in Kentucky that is a hunting ground for killer clowns…clowns who hunt people…cruel and abusive people. When the circus comes to town, those who violate the helpless soon find themselves the victims of the brutal justice of the clowns, our twisted deliverers of comeuppance!
But what of the abused? What happens to them when the clowns return with them to the big top? Where do they go?
A small band of locals, including two very good clowns, investigates those very questions when they join together to recover a little boy liberated by the clowns from his violent excuses for parents.
The Standard Cover to the VICIOUS CIRCUS Graphic Novel - art by Amanda Rachels with colors by Nathan Lueth!
THE PROJECT
Vicious Circus was originally released in 2010 as Clown Town, but its creators – writer Kevin LaPorte (The Absentee, Last Ride for Horsemen, Roadkill du Jour) and artist Amanda Rachels (Flesh of White and Arcana Studios’ The Book) – have revisited their seminal graphic novel and elevated it to modern comics standards in every way:
New colors by Nathan Lueth!
New lettering and updated script throughout!
Updated art and layouts by Amanda Rachels on many pages!
A sharp rebranding as Vicious Circus!
Check out the upgrade in colors from Clown Town to Vicious Circus!
We felt the story of Clown Town held up well over the years, that it mattered, and that, as such, it deserved to be reprinted...but only after the above changes were made to make it a work to be (more) proud of!
The funds raised from this Kickstarter campaign will be used to bring Vicious Circus to print and to distribute it far and wide! Funds will also be used, naturally, to produce and fulfill rewards for YOU, our esteemed and gracious Backers!
THE PREVIEW
The Kickstarter-Exclusive Cover to the VICIOUS CIRCUS Graphic Novel - art by Amanda Rachels with colors by Nathan Lueth!
Fully Rendered Interior Page from Vicious Circus!
Fully Rendered Interior Page from Vicious Circus!
Fully Rendered Interior Page from Vicious Circus!
THE CREATORS
The Writer
Kevin LaPorte is the Fairhope, Alabama-based writer and co-creator of genre comics with a horror bent! The worlds Kevin creates range from the bayou territory of a lone motorcycle gangster seeking vengeance for his cursed appetite for street meat and the slaughter of his brothers-in-arms (Roadkill du Jour) to dark carnivals overrun by killer clowns violently avenging abused children (Vicious Circus) to dying frontier towns in the Old West beset by Steampunk versions of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Last Ride for Horsemen) to hellish dimensions replete with untapped energy mined by unsuspecting adventurers ripe for demonic possession (The Absentee)!
The Artist
Amanda Rachels' love of horror has been a heavy influence on her comics work: Vicious Circus, a tale of killer clowns with a twist, and Arcana Studios' The Book, which explores the dark side of traveling off the beaten path. She was a frequent contributor to Grayhaven Comics' The Gathering anthology (including several covers). She also completed art for Eyes of the Hurricane - a regional tale of hurricane survival!
The Colorist
Nathan Lueth came into existence with a pencil in his hand, a feat which continues to confound obstetricians to this day. No one knows for sure when he started drawing or where his love of comics came from, but most experts agree that his professional career began after graduating from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design, as a caricaturist in the Mall of America. Soon he was freelance illustrating for the likes of Target, General Mills, and Round Table Comics. 
When not drawing comics for other people, he draws his own steam-fantasy webcomic, Impure Blood (www.impurebloodwebcomic.com) 
 He currently resides in St. Paul, Minnesota with two cats, a turtle, his wife, Nadja, and wonderful daughter, Katja.
THE KICKSTARTER PEDIGREE
Kevin and Amanda have led SIXTEEN previous, successful Kickstarter campaigns, including those for Roadkill du Jour 1-4; one each for the steampunk Western tale of the Apocalypse, Last Ride for Horsemen; the sci-fi/horror tale of demonic possession, The Absentee (issues 1 and 2); and the inspirational tale of hurricane survival, Eyes of the Hurricane; four for the serialized horror graphic novel, Clown Town; as well as another for Ancients & Warriors: The Sketch Art of Gavin Michelli, and they organized the campaigns for Erica Heflin and Amanda's Flesh of White 1-3! We are experienced and reliable creators and purveyors of comics via Kickstarter. You will get what you pledge for and get it quickly.
THE REWARDS
The Kickstarter-Exclusive Stagefright Print
Amanda Rachels' Kickstarter-Exclusive STAGEFRIGHT Print - 6.5" x 10" - Available at the $35 Reward Tier OR Simply Add $10 to Your Existing Pledge!
The Bookplate
Bookplates are Kickstarter-Exclusive, 3.5" x 10.25" cardstock inserts that will be signed, numbered and personalized for YOU! The 'Bennie & Berniece' Bookplate below comes with ALL print reward tiers!
The 'Bennie & Berniece' Bookplate - Available with ALL Print Reward Tiers!
Original Art by Amanda Rachels
Amanda is kindly offering up numerous pieces of original art - including her original pencil-&-ink work on the Vicious Circus covers and bookplates, as well as opportunities for custom, commission art!
Amanda Rachels' ORIGINAL ART for the Vicious Circus Single-Issue #2 Cover! Available at the $80 Reward Tier!
Amanda Rachels' ORIGINAL ART for the Vicious Circus Single-Issue #3 Cover! Available at the $80 Reward Tier!
The Personalized Sketch Print
6.5" x 10" SKETCH PRINT by Amanda Rachels featuring our ringmaster, Stagefright, and YOUR FACE in pencil-&-ink, rendered by Amanda on the Clown Town Wheel of Misfortune!
Stagefright Sketch Print to Feature YOUR FACE in Pencil-&-Ink by Amanda Rachels! Available at the $40 Reward Tier!
Custom Art Commissions by Amanda Rachels!
Amanda is also making available a limited number of custom art commissions (single-figure, limited-color, pencil-&-ink on 9" x 12" Bristol Board) for Backers of Vicious Circus! Check out these gorgeous examples of her commission work from various genres:
A Game of Thrones' Red Viper Commission by Amanda Rachels!
She-Hulk Commission by Amanda Rachels!
Cobra Commander Commission by Amanda Rachels!
Single Issues!
Although Vicious Circus is being released as a complete, 104-page graphic novel, we are making available a LIMITED number of 4-issue sets of single issues, available ONLY via specific tiers in this Kickstarter campaign or our Patreon campaign! Each single issue has an EXCLUSIVE COVER by Amanda Rachels and Nathan Lueth, making them collectors' items in their own right!
Vicious Circus in 4 SINGLE ISSUES - Exclusive, Alternate Covers 1 & 2 by Amanda Rachels & Nathan Lueth!
The Deluxe Sketch Cover Set
Amanda will create FOUR unique sketch covers, one for each single-issue version of the story, each in pencil-&-ink and color (marker and/or watercolor) with special extras! ONLY FIVE such sets will EVER be produced!
Deluxe Sketch Cover - This + 3 MORE will be covered in a UNIQUE Vicious Circus Sketch Cover by Amanda Rachels in FULL COLOR!

campaign.story:
THE LONG-AWAITED MIKE PLOOG CAREER RETROSPECTIVE ART BOOK IS HERE! 
Hello, fellow Ploog fans! We are happy to tell you that the wait is over. Finally, a comprehensive art book on Mike Ploog is in the works. This 9" x 12", 320-page retrospective will cover almost every aspect of Mike’s career, from his earliest days of working with “Leatherneck Magazine,” while he was still in the Marines, right up through his latest work on “Goliath.” “The Art of Ploog” will contain, quite literally, hundreds of pieces of art from throughout his career, as well as commentary by the master himself. 
You’ll find all his best known works in this book. Included is the work he did for Marvel comics (on titles such as “Frankenstein,” “Ghost Rider,” “Planet of the Apes,” and “Werewolf By Night”), as well as a wide range of his film work on animated features (such as “Lord of the Rings,” “Prince of Egypt,” “Shrek,” and “Wizards”) and live-action features (including “Little Shop of Horrors,” “John Carpenter's THE THING,” and “X-MEN”). The book will also contain many of his most popular paintings; paintings that were created for his own fantasy art trading card series; as well as paintings he worked on for the collectible card games “Guardians” and “Magic the Gathering,” most of which have never been reproduced larger than trading card size. It’s the ultimate collection spanning his entire career. 
This is the book for all our fellow Ploogies out there. We hope you’ll join us for the most comprehensive work ever produced on the magical worlds of Mike Ploog.
REWARDS:
SPECIAL LIMITED EDITIONS:
A NOTE ABOUT SHIPPING 
WITHIN THE UNITED STATES:
All domestic pledge amounts include USPS Media Mail shipping, except where noted in the final two reward tiers.
EVERYWHERE ELSE:
There are limited options for international shipping. Based on the size and weight of each book, we are unable to offer the less expensive first-class mail option which has size restrictions and a four-pound limit. International orders must be shipped using International Priority Mail, which is, unfortunately, more expensive. We value every pledge and apologize that we must pass this expense along to you. It is important to note that taxes and fees vary by country. Please be aware that international orders may be subject to a duty tax by your local postal station.
STRETCH GOALS:
Thanks to all of our supporters, we have reached our first stretch goal! Now EVERY REWARD LEVEL will also receive a set of five 8" x 10" high-quality, full-color prints. 
Included are: “The Balrog,” “The Mercenary,” “Night Howl,” “The Werewolf,” and “The Wraith.”
THANKS SO MUCH! 
We are thrilled to have reached our second stretch goal of $80,000! Now, EVERY REWARD LEVEL will also receive an 8.5" x 11", 64-page softcover book containing several of Mike's storyboard sequences.
These drawings will be reproduced close to actual size to showcase the creativity Mike put into each storyboard and display the beautiful, detailed pencil work of each drawing.
THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Here we are in the final week of our campaign! Thank you so much to all of our backers! We are very grateful to each and every one of you for your support.
In our quest to continue to reach more fans for "THE ART OF PLOOG," we have added a very cool third Stretch Goal at the $100,000 mark.
If we reach this goal, each reward level will also receive an autographed print by Mike Ploog! This hand signed, frame-worthy, high quality print will be a real tip-of-the-hat to Mike's famous 1972 cover art from "Werewolf By Night #1!" The image size will be the same as the original bronze-age comic that it pays homage to, and it will be STRICTLY LIMITED to the exact amount of pledges this Kickstarter campaign receives. Plus, just like the first two Stretch Goals, there is no additional shipping cost.
Please continue to help us spread the word about “THE ART OF PLOOG!”
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When it comes to publishing such a large, comprehensive art book, our biggest challenge was compiling all of the artwork. Well, we have completed that task! Now, it's time to shoot sharp, high quality film on large pieces, and create crystal clear, high-resolution scans from smaller works.

Extensive interviews have been done with Mike Ploog, completed over a two-week time span, so it's now time for the editorial team to get to work matching art with words. 

There are zero risks that this book will not be produced. We are passionate about this project. Simply stated: It's long overdue for an extensive, coffee table art book on Mike Ploog, and we won't let his fans down!

campaign.story:
The idea behind this Kickstarter campaign is to create a weekly webcomic, The Eighth Day, that will feature 48 yearly pages starting with the first week of January. Those pages will be collected into individual 24-page comics and will be made available online and at conventions. Currently, it's a black-and-white comic, though we will possibly be adding in colors with a stretch goal. 
The funding will be used to cover costs of creating and hosting the webcomic for all of 2016 and, hopefully, beyond. But, for certain, a full year of webcomic and the first 24 pages collected into Issue No. 1 and printed for our backers, who will get to see those first 24 pages before anyone else. 
The Eighth Day was written by Sam Eggleston and is being drawn by Roberta Ingranata and lettered by John Hunt. The story is being edited by Kim Eggleston. 
Ingranata and Hunt are both industry pros with Ingranata currently working on Zenescope's Robyn Hood title and Hunt having a background with several major publishers as both a letterer and a colorist. 
Sam Eggleston has written several independent books, including Last Breath, Cazadora (soon to be a mini-series from Action Lab Entertainment) and Dead by Wednesday, all of which were successful Kickstarters. Kim Eggleston is also a comic writer (Dead by Wednesday) and has edited just about everything Sam has written. 
The story
T8D page 1
The Christian bible states that God created everything over the course of six days, and on the seventh day he rested. 
Science tells us that creation takes a much longer time period. That a day, quite frankly, isn't going to cut it. 
Which one is right? What if they are both right? 
T8D Page 2
The Eighth Day tells the story of Devani, who is living life on an Earth that has succumbed to a terrible disease that transforms those who contract it into hideous creatures that cannot be exposed to sunlight and that feed on any living thing they can catch. There are those who are immune to it, like Devani, but their numbers are dwindling and humanity stands on the brink of extinction. 
The world is quiet. Where once great populations lived in cities, only a few souls still remain. 
T8D Page 3
Devani doesn't think about how quiet it is. She's focused on surviving each day, collecting what she needs and staying safe indoors at night. But what she doesn't know is that the quiet -- the lack of other people around her -- is about to reveal something amazing: That we were all, indeed, created in God's image. 
T8D page 4
The rewards
When it comes to Kickstarters, I have done the really complicated route and the less-complicated route and this time around I'm trying the not-complicated-at-all route. 

Basically, you can get hard copies of the first comic, which would be a 24-pager that would give you a nice head start on the story (about six months ahead of the web readers), and you can get prints and other comics and even some commissions. 
For the commissions, you can get work by Jay De Foy (Dead by Wednesday), Jason Baroody (Combat Jacks, Last Breath) or Brian Lopez-Santos. They all do great commission work and you can see samples of their work by following the links for each of them. 
PLEASE NOTE: Commissions are for ONE character. To add a second character, it will be and additional 50-percent of the purchase. For the 9x12 full-body, for example, it's $100 for one character. For there to be two characters, it will cost $150. Drop me a note if you want more than two characters, or detailed backgrounds. 
One lucky backer will also be able to get a 9x12 bust commission done by Billy Tucci (Shi, Sgt. Rock). Make sure to grab that one before it's gone because it's limited to just a single backer at the $100 tier. 

UPDATE: Roberta Ingranata has made herself available for limited commissions through this Kickstarter. So, if you're a fan of hers, now is the time to strike. 
If you're interested in buying more than one copy of the comic, please add $10 for every additional copy you want. If you want more than 5 copies, please contact me and we will work out a price point, depending on what you need. 
Sketch Covers
Dejah of Mars by Brian Lopez-Santos
Ghost Rider cover by Brian Lopez-Santos
Dredd cover by Brian Lopez-Santos
Batman Sketch Cover
Wolverine sketch cover
The Hulk sketch cover
 Other
Power Girl by Brian Lopez-Santos (11x17)
Spider-Gwen by Jason Baroody (8x11)
Green Arrow on comic backer board by Brian Lopez-Santos
Superman by Brian Lopez-Santos (comic backer board)
Supergirl colored pencil art by Adriana Tavares (11x17)
I've tried to make the rewards very clear, but if you have any questions whatsoever, please don't hesitate to contact me. I'll get back to you as soon as possible. 
Stretch goals
Personally, I'm not a big fan of stretch goals -- but I know Kickstarter backers are and that's why we try to make them a reality. 
$4,500 -- Digital Underground: Everyone will receive a PDF of Dead by Wednesday #1 and Last Breath. 
$5,000 -- Post up: Everyone who is getting a physical reward will now also get TWO postcards based on The Eighth Day. 
$5,750 -- Over the rainbow: Colored pages for the print edition of The Eighth Day #1. Colors will be by Michael Woods. Backers will be able to choose between a colored version of the print comic, or black and white. 
$6,250 -- Variety is the spice of life: We'll have a variant cover created and backers will be able to choose if they want the original cover or the variant as their reward. 
$7,000 -- There's always room for more: If we hit $7,000, the creative team will add four pages to the print copy that will ONLY be available in print. The webcomic won't get them. 
$9,000 -- The Eighth Day #2! At this point, we'll be in a good spot to produce the second part of the story in print format. We'll also offer it up in color and in black and white and we'll be sending it to you along with issue No. 1. Please note, however, that we'd probably experience about a two month delay in getting everyone's rewards in their hands. We want to keep the quality the same from start to finish, so we'd want to give everyone ample time to make No. 2 as solid as No. 1. 
Here's an example of the coloring with Page 5. Note how we're looking at a much "flatter" feel that I feel exemplifies the mood of the book: 
T8D Page 5
T8D Page 5 w/ colors by Michael Woods
Complete transparency
I just want to make sure everyone is aware that this Kickstarter is running concurrently with another project I am finishing up. Dead by Wednesday was a successful Kickstarter I ran for a comic my wife and I wrote that is currently being printed and will be getting mailed out to backers in June and July. I don't foresee anything being delayed with that project, but I wanted to be able to keep moving with other projects and other creative teams so I decided to move forward with The Eighth Day while I finished up DBW. 

If you have any questions about that, feel free to contact me and I'll answer them for you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always challenges. There are almost always delays. There seems to always be something unexpected that comes up. 

These are just the facts of Kickstarter. Projects have bumps. 

However, we are in a great spot with The Eighth Day and I believe we'll not only slide through without having any deadline issues, but we'll finish up well in advance. 

If any delays do come up, I'll inform all the of the backers immediately via updates, and I am always available to anyone who has any questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers! 

Again, let me say thank you for helping me make this project a success. Things are going as planned with The Eighth Day and the first 24 pages are completed, including lettering. 

I'll be buying my domain name and getting the website set up for the weekly web comic in the next couple of weeks, and I'll be sending the pages off to the printer for your print book (yay!) in the next few days. I just need to complete the page with the list of backers on it and I'll be ready to get it out the door and on the printing press. 

So, that means, as of right now, everything is on schedule (crazy, hey?). I'll begin shipping packages in early January and should have most of them done and gone by the end of that month. If I have any delays with anyone, I'll let them know so they aren't left in limbo. 

Most of the commissions have come back in, though some are still being worked on. But that's OK... it's usually how this process works. 

Thank you again! If you have any questions, drop me a line. :)

We did it! We really did it! 

It is thrilling that this Kickstarter was successful. It will really open up that door for this new webcomic and will make it an absolute reality. I am so happy and so very grateful. 

I do apologize that it took so long to post this. I was out all last week with a back injury and couldn't even sit up to use the computer, and when I started feeling better, I had to go out of town to run a football camp where I didn't have access to any internet. 

But I wanted to take a moment before things really get rolling and say "thank you" to all of you who backed this project. I couldn't have done it without you. 

The timeline from here forward will start with Kickstarter collecting the pledges (be on the lookout for an email that indicates your funding was successful or if it was denied for any reason -- if it was denied, just enter new payment details and Kickstarter will handle the rest). 

Once that is finished, Kickstarter will send me the funds around the end of the month and then the real work begins! 

In the next few weeks, I will send out surveys to everyone who has a commission as their reward so we can get the artists started on them. We are hoping for a nice, quick turnaround for the entire project. 

Thank you again! And feel free to drop me a message if you have any questions!

We did it! The Kickstarter is fully funded! This baby is going to be a reality and it's all because of awesome backers like you. And you! And you! And, yes, you, too! 

The project reached its funding goal yesterday, but I have been bedridden since Monday as I threw out my back. Today is the first day I've been able to actually sit up and write this update. So, I apologize to everyone for a lack of keeping you in the loop, but I'm back and we still have just over a full day left.

EARTH OUTLAWS #1
WHAT'S THE STORY? 
During a space expedition, a massive meteor impacts a Space Shuttle sending it and its crew into deep space. With no signal and lost communication, NASA believed the astronauts were lost forever. They declared the mission a tragic lost and announced the names of those on board. One of those astronauts was Dane Quaid’s brother, Daniel. Quaid refused to accept this. So he asked NASA to coordinate a search and rescue team to find his brother and the rest of the crew. They declined. Desperate to find his brother, Quaid enlisted the help from his father James Quaid, retired space marine; his girlfriend, Casey Hathaway, technologist and long time friend, Bill Richards, weapon specialist. Together they hijacked one of NASA’s most advanced space shuttles. Be amazed Studios invites you to join the crew as they undertake a quest to find Quaid's lost brother - a mission that make them targets for bounty hunters, pirates and alien cyborgs, and eventually fugitives from Earth!

If we hit $3000 I am giving everyone a free Cyberine trading card. YES! Even you $4 digital guys! Everyone who pledges over $4 will get this awesome reward!
Also, Everyone who backs this project will get their name on the backer's page in Cyberines #1. Everyone!
Cyberine, the USCC and Shadowflame.
Cyberines #1 takes us to the next step of human evolution. We delve into the past of what turned one of the Cyberines into a deadly enemy. Was he always destined to be? We also introduce a new "Villain". The Persian freedom fighter Sirocco. Is he friend, or the worst type of foe?
The story, is a simple one. When I was 14 years old I created my Captain America mixed with The Six Million Dollar Man hero, Cyberine. That is 1985 to you young pups. In Bergen Tech Print Shop, Mr. Pavlu tasked us with creating a flyer for something that interested us. Me being a huge comic fan and also had just read Captain America with Deathlok, I created a character to be in that vein. I was also very patriotic as a teen. I still am. 
Cyberine made his first appearance alongside Agent Napalm in Shadowflame #2(1996/2007) to arrest Billy Barnes, also knows as KillWatt the Electrocutioner. He was hired by Don Tony Baltinetti to kill Shadowflame for disrespecting his nephew Tommy. 
The Cyberines, or United States Cyberine Corps made their first full appearance in Shadowflame #4(1997/2007) where they helped Shadowflame fight and defeat Maldestrak. 
Cyberine was in a tragic accident that required the government to make him better, stronger and faster. The cost was a helluva lot more than $6 million dollars.
The Cyberines follows a "family" of Cybernetic Marines. They are the top tier of elite combat class of soldier: the USCC, the United States Cyberine Corps. Their members are recruited and trained at a young age and then cybernetically or genetically enhanced. This can be due to an accident or injury that has occurred in the line of duty or just to unlock their genetic potential.
Cyberines #1 cover by Cory Hamscher and Sean Forney
Joe, Jeff and Sean's cover.
The Cyberines first appeared in the Shadowflame mini-series from 1996.
I no longer have the first Cyberine drawing that I did. But this is from 1986!
Special thanks to the creative team, Cory Hamscher, Pow Rodrix, Sean Forney, Ed Dukeshire DW from Fanboysinc and R.J. Michaels.

STRETCH GOAL #2 ANNOUNCED!!!
Great news! As of this past weekend, BLOODSUCKER BLUES has been officially funded! It was such a good weekend that we unlocked our first stretch goal! That means that everyone who pledged at the $15.00 level or higher will also receive a really cool custom-designed bookmark with their CDs!
We're also announcing another stretch goal! If we hit $1,600.00 by the end of the campaign, everyone who pledged at the $15.00 level or higher will also receive a cool postcard magnet! Perfect for your fridge or office, it's going to feature a subtle design that won't have vampires plastered all over it but will still look very cool.
Bookmark/Magnet preliminary design
STRETCH GOAL #1 UNLOCKED!!!
As of Saturday, October 17th, I'm excited to announce that Bloodsucker Blues has been 100% funded!! This means we can announce our first stretch goal! If the project reaches $1,300 in pledges by the end of the campaign, everyone who pledged at the $15.00 level or above will also receive a customized, full-color bookmark! We realize you can't bookmark an audiobook, but for those physical books you still read, this die-cut, spot-UV gloss, heavy cardstock bookmark will be a sharp-looking way to keep your place!
Thank you so much to everyone who pledged!!!
ABOUT THIS PROJECT:
Thank you for visiting my Kickstarter page! It's greatly appreciated!
BLOODSUCKER BLUES: A VAMPS IN VEGAS STORY is an Amazon Top-10 bestselling novella with a lot of humor and, of course, vampires.
The story introduces us to Alex, a vampire who lives in Las Vegas (a thriving vampire community) that ends up in trouble with people he doesn't want to be in trouble with. Along the way, we are introduced to Alex's particular brand of snarky humor.
The book has been a success online where it is available for digital download (tinyurl.com/vampsvegas to check it out and read some reviews.) This is the audiobook adaptation of it.
The audiobook will be about an hour long, professionally narrated and produced, and will come via digital download or in CD format in a professionally produced, full-color Digipack, depending on which tier you pledge.
WHO AM I?
In addition to being the book's author, I am also a three-time award winning voice actor, podcast host, and audiobook narrator. I've narrated and produced over a dozen audiobooks, and I'm bringing that experience and passion to this project!
AN EXCERPT FROM THE BOOK:
Everything you know about vampires is wrong.
I mean, sure, we do drink blood. And yes, we have fangs, (Have you ever tried to pierce the skin on someone's neck without them? Okay, probably not, but trust me, it's next to impossible.) And, yes, a stake to the heart will kill us, but to quote a popular animated movie, "Who wouldn't that kill?" Other than that, a good old-fashioned beheading will pretty much do it, but not much else.
Everything else you've learned from Hollywood and fiction about vampires? It's generally... well, complete bullshit.
For example, sunlight? Listen, I don't want to spend any more time in it than I have to, but mostly exposure to sunlight just feels like a bad rash. It doesn't kill us. Some of us with higher pain thresholds have even taken up tanning. It's a trend in vampire culture lately. We call it "sunfanging."
And we sure as hell don't sparkle.
Will I cringe if you wave a cross at me? Only if you follow it up with a sentence like, "Have you accepted Jesus Christ as your personal lord and savior?" I have no particular truck with religion, it's just not my thing. And I've never quite understood why people want to go to strangers' houses and talk about god, anyway. That seems like a good way to spend a day getting doors slammed in your face.
So how do I know all this?
Simple. I'm a vampire. And my name... is Alex Blood.
Bwah ha ha ha ha! Oh my god, I'm just kidding! Could you imagine?! The vampire community would eat me alive (no pun intended) if I had the balls to call myself Alex Blood! That's a bit on the nose, don't you think? Holy shit, Alex Blood... please.
WHAT ARE THE FUNDS FOR?
I will be using the Kickstarter funds for the cost of producing the CDs, the shipping and packaging costs, and the Kickstarter and Amazon Fees, plus some additional costs for mastering as well as some ancillary equipment for recording. 
WHEN WILL I GET IT?
The audiobooks will be delivered via download almost immediately after the Kickstarter campaign ends, while the physical copies will ship out about two weeks after that. I expect to have all rewards in backers' hands by the end of November.

THE PROJECT:
The purpose of this Kickstarter is to collect The Argonauts issues 1-6 and help ensure that the series continues.
Argonauts—co-created by writer and Harvey Award Nominee Keith Dallas and artist Robert Saunders—features eight principal characters from different time periods (specifically the Norwegian Middle Ages and the outer rim of the Milky Way galaxy in the 27th century) who are brought together by an unknown force right before a malevolent alien race threatens to enslave humanity in modern day America. If these powerful adventurers have any hope of banding together to repel the invasion, they’ll have to overcome the language barriers that keep them from understanding each other. As the alien invasion draws closer and closer, the story flashes back to each character’s past, providing a unique window to their motivations and desires and illuminating the mystery behind their travels through time.
REVIEWS OF THE ARGONAUTS
"I’m really liking this series. It has a great indie superhero vibe going on, and the story is fun and easy to follow." - ComicAttack.net
"The makers of this book know comics and know how to make fun comics. I especially like the character designs; original and iconic. This book is worth a look." - Ain't it Cool News
"Issue #2 ends on a backward Doctor Who moment. What more could I ask for? Dallas, Saunders and Towry make Argonauts a pleasure to experience." - ComicsBulletin.com
READ THE ENTIRE FIRST ISSUE HERE
READ THE ENTIRE SECOND ISSUE HERE
READ THE ENTIRE THIRD ISSUE HERE
WHAT’S IN THE BOOK? 
The physical graphic novel will contain the previously published Argonauts #1-6 (totaling 143 story pages), Each issue's cover and a gallery of design art and pinups. (If you want to let a more detailed look at Argonauts, go to TJ Comics’ website (http://tjcomics.com/argonauts/) where many pages of the first six issues have been posted.)
WHAT MAKES ARGONAUTS UNIQUE?
Argonauts isn’t just another costumed hero comic book. While presenting a science fiction story that involves time travel and alien invasions, Argonauts principally operates on character interaction and the pitfalls of “miscommunication.” Since all the characters hail from different time periods and different locations, they don’t speak the same language. Therefore, intentions and actions are misunderstood. Even when characters DO speak the same language, confusion still reigns, producing more conflict and strife. As such, a prevalent “Tower of Babel” theme runs throughout the narrative, expanding the story’s scope.
WHO IS ARGONAUTS FOR?
Argonauts is for anyone who likes a thrilling, action-packed adventure with intriguing character interaction. Since none of the violence is gory, and all profanity is censored, Argonauts is appropriate for anyone who can watch a PG-13 movie.
THE CREATORS
Keith Dallas was editor-in-chief of ComicsBulletin.com for many years before becoming a writer for such comic book companies as Th3rd World Studios (Omega Chase), IDW (Ghostbusters) and Dynamite Entertainment (Stan Lee’s How To Draw Super Heroes). He has written and edited many books for TwoMorrows Publishing including the Harvey Award nominated American Comic Book Chronicles, the decade-by-decade comic book history series, and the best-selling Flash Companion.
Robert Saunders is a Graphic Artist/Illustrator from Vancouver, Canada. He has been illustrating for over 30 years and his previous comic work includes ARComics: The Frontiers and Bravo.
Other Argonauts contributors include DC/Marvel artist Scott Kolins, award-winning colorist Moose Baumann, artists Patrick O’Donnell and T.J. Sangalang, colorists Kote Carvajal, Donna Gregory, John Hunt, Omi Remalante and Jon Towry, and letterer Wilson Ramos Jr.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Kickstarter is the most practical method for funding independent print runs (which ain’t cheap). Argonauts has been plotted as a three volume project, and the success of this Kickstarter campaign will assure the creators that Argonauts has the reader support to produce more volumes.
REWARDS
In addition to a hard copy of the book, we’ve lined up some unique rewards for various pledge levels including personalized sketches, a rare retailer-incentive copy of a Ghostbusters comic book, American Comic Book Chronicles volumes and participation in a Long Island launch party!
If you choose the “Artist Sketch Reward” level, Robert Saunders will draw you a one character sketch similar to what you see below (you choose the character you want Robert to draw).
WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?
Into the print run, shipping fees, Kickstarter fees and Amazon fees.The production of the book is finished.Any leftover funds will go directly into the production of the next Argonauts book.

campaign.story:
Thanks for checking out the Kickstarter for Malice and Mistletoe, a rollicking fun Christmas tale of bloodshed and treachery, brought to you by the delinquent minds of Nathan Graham Davis and Jack Purcell.
Your pledges will be going toward 1,500 Limited Edition copies of Malice and Mistletoe, featuring a cover we'll never use again. Every backer at the book level and above will receive one of these, numbered and signed by both of us. Every backer who contributes anything will be thanked in the final pages of the book!
Also up for grabs are T-shirts, whiskey glasses, commissions by Jack, original pages of Malice and Mistletoe, and an opportunity for you to become part of the book itself.
We'll be producing a high-quality, 120-page book with an exclusive cover. Interior pages will be B&W, with splashes of red and green -- kind of a festive Sin City. If our project is funded, we'll introduce stretch goals that will allow us to produce a 140-150 page book with a hardcover.
We'll also be signing and numbering every single one of these for no additional charge. You're helping us get them made, so we figure we can write our names down. Want Jack to draw you a head sketch along with his signature? Add $10 to any category and we'll get in touch for more info.
Select this option and we'll reach out to you to get a size.
These tie right into the book itself. Mistletoe is a sinister whiskey, distilled by Krampus and the elves of the Antarctic. While Kickstarter won't let us offer alcohol (and we're also missing a key ingredient), we are STOKED to be putting these up for grabs. You'll get a pair of 12 oz whiskey glasses -- one red, one green -- laser-etched with the Mistletoe "M" logo.
Jack's commissions normally start at $100, which is our project's price point for both a commission and a signed, numbered book. When you select this option, we'll get in touch to find out what you're looking for, be it a character from Malice and Mistletoe, or an entirely different character of your choice. No matter what you choose, it'll be a top-notch piece of original art, on 11x17 paper, ready to frame.
A lot like the normal commissions, except in full greyscale, with a splash or two of color. These will make for some SERIOUS wall art. Not only that, but Jack normally starts pricing on these at $200, so you're essentially getting one of these bad boys for $45 off.
We set these up as part of the $230 level, but you can also add $80 to any reward that includes a normal commission, if one of the others catches your eye.
While we won't be including splash pages, we can guarantee that the pages received from this reward will be highlights from the book. If you select this option, we'll touch base with you in an effort to customize the selection to your preferences (such as whether or not you want something bloody).
Want to be in our book? You can! If you elect to have a character take on your likeness, you can even opt to have him/her killed. Select one of these rewards, and we'll get in touch to find out how you want your name written, or get a couple pictures to help Jack capture your good looks.
Just a heads up -- we'll also need a signed release saying it's okay for us to use said name/likeness. And yes, you can definitely select this reward on behalf of someone else, as long as we can get a similar release.
Would you rather have your company/project namedropped in the book? Get in touch with us beforehand and we'll see if we can make it work.
Since shipping varies wildly between countries, please reach out to us first. Feel free to e-mail us at maliceandmistletoe@gmail.com. Thanks!
If you're a brick and mortar store or a reputable, online retailer, we'd love to work with you during this campaign. E-mail us at maliceandmistletoe@gmail.com, and we should be able to work out a big discount on multiple copies of the book, especially if you're local.
All rewards will be shipped together, as soon as we receive the books. We are currently producing pages, and plan to send them to the printers right around the new year. They'll be coming from overseas, so delivery is tough to pin down. We're aiming for early spring, 2015, but it could run as late as May.
Shipping costs are worked into the rewards themselves. Jack has shipped innumerable amounts of art over the years and can assure you that yours will arrive in amazing condition.
Christmas is business.

Toy companies, movie theaters, lingerie boutiques, confectioneries... shit -- even the hospitals clean up. Your grotesque Uncle Alan couldn't turn down that last piece of pie. The "Ho-Ho Heart Attack," they call it.


At the top of this trillion-dollar capitalist empire is Claus, and he traded his furs for bespoke Armani about the same time his rosy-nosed visage started popping up in Coke ads. Now, he sits on the throne of a bona-fide Arctic kingdom, complete with serfs and concubines. Only one problem --

Krampus.

The infamous Yuletide tot-tormenter. He wasn't keen on the holly jolly direction of the new Christmas, and there was an uprising. When enough blood was shed and Krampus' defeat was apparent, he fled to Antarctica with the few elves who shared his cause.

Together, over a century, they built a new home. A frozen wild west, where they began to produce a euphoric whiskey called "Mistletoe." Sought after by the world's elite, it afforded Krampus and his followers a chance to rebuild and seek revenge.

Thanksgiving night. Six of the world's most powerful CEOs are brutally murdered, with the Mistletoe logo scrawled in blood at every crime scene. Each was a longtime business partner of Claus'.

And this is where Eldon Carrillo comes in. To most people, he's nothing but a brooding loner who lives on a secluded estate, deep in the Nordic countryside. To those who've heard the stories, he's a ruthless, ghost-like assassin. To Claus, he's someone who can deliver the best Christmas gift ever -- Krampus' head on a fucking platter.
Purcell
Jack Purcell is a veteran of comics, having worked on multiple titles for Marvel and DC Comics, including Gotham Underground, Batman, and Green Arrow.
Davis
Nathan Graham Davis normally works as a screenwriter, and currently has a project in development with 1984 Private Defense Contractors (producers of Dredd and The Grey).

Both are thankful to live in the artist-friendly town of Easthampton, MA, and both look forward to becoming more friendly artists by way of the above-mentioned whiskey glasses.
We're also stoked to announce that Davin Pasek (34-design) will be handling lettering/coloring/design, and Mark (epic Mickey) Stefanowicz will be contributing additional design!
THE BACKSTORY:
The concept for this project hatched in early 2012 as a bit of midnight inspiration – the type that wills you out of bed to write it down. A screenwriter, Nathan worked up a treatment, then sent it to his manager and a few friends in the business.
The overwhelming response? “No one in Hollywood will ever touch this. Ever.” It's too dark. Too out-there. You don't fuck with Christmas. So, rather than waste six months of his life writing what would likely be a dead-end, Nathan dropped it.
Flash-forward to near-Christmas, 2013. Nathan's going through old files, happens upon the treatment, and feels the painful bite of missed opportunity. This idea deserved another chance. Not as a movie, but in a medium that still depended heavily on visuals – a graphic novel.
Nathan combed through online databases for artists, and discovered there was an incredible, experienced inker, living right in his hometown. He immediately sent Jack a message, saying he loved his work, had an idea, and would he please let him buy him a few beers at the local watering hole.
Jack had been honing his craft for years, drawing and inking for some of the most prolific comic book characters on Earth. He was ready to take that experience to another level, and create something new. The timing was right, he dug the idea, and now we've got months of concept art, extensive outlining, script, and finished pages to show for it. We are ready to dive in and make this thing.
That's where you come in.
We would love for you to get in on the first-ever printing of Malice and Mistletoe. By backing us, you'll be casting a vote for originality. Your support will help prove that the world doesn't need another paint-by-numbers story. That there's room for something unique, dark, and – dare-we-say – really fucking out-there.
Through your pledges and support, we're going to make something awesome.
More Info:
Feel free to hit us up with any questions at maliceandmistletoe@gmail.com.  We'll get back to you as soon as humanly possible.

campaign.story:
Welcome!   
Joe Relaxing
 In 1962 while working for Treasure Chest, Joe was so thrilled doing the Story of Pope John XXIII, he sent pages of "Fantastic Four #6" Back to Stan Lee, because he did not have time to do all of them.  In fact he pencilled and Inked The Story of Pope John XXIII by day and Penciled and Inked Thor by night, All while never missing his Son's athletic events or coaching sports teams. Joe is amazing. 
This Story was broken up through several issues of Treasure Ches,t and being among Joe's most cherished works, Joe has always longed to see it in a larger, more complete format. The Story of Pope John XXIII is fascinating. 
Angelo Roncalli was born to a working family in a very small poor villiage. one of 13 children, he overcame hardship to become one of the most loved Popes. His life was interesting, as he showed his affection to all people all the time. 
Even the Nazis, allowed him to visit prisoners while he was in Bulgaia, he ministered to Catholics and Non-Catholics alike. When he was sent to Turkey the Bulgarian People were all sad to see him go, he was respected so much. 
Joe's Story flow is spectacular as he illustrates, a wondrous story of a man's life, who was loved so by millions, that he had been made a Saint, on April 27, 2014. To commemorate this, Joe really wanted to print the story in a larger format, in one Beautifully done Hard Cover edition. 
Mark Sinnott and I, Scanned each page twice, as they were to big for a large scanner.  I stitched the two scans per page together.  Once prepped, the files were ready for coloring.  I put out a call for a colorists. Mike Deodato told me he had a friend that could handle the job well. Enter Leonardo Ito, currently in Japan.  I showed Leonardo scans, and we came to a more classical look of comics, with a hint of modernism. Also we wanted to correct the original, to be as accurate historically, as we could get it. The original had been colored, but with not a lot of accuracy.  
Joe Sinnott has been an artist his whole life, in fact, lets see a bit of his biography so you will see what I mean, 
Joe Sinnott (born October 16, 1926, Saugerties, New York, United States) is an American comic book artist. Working primarily as an inker, Sinnott is best-known for his long stint on Marvel Comics' Fantastic Four, from 1965 to 1981 (with a brief return in the late 1980s), initially over the pencils of industry legend Jack Kirby. Years before, he had inked Kirby's The Fantastic Four #5 (July 1962), the issue introducing Dr. Doom, plus a science fiction monster story in Strange Tales #94 (March 1962). In 1964 Joe was contacted by Brian Epstein to pencil, and Ink, the Biography for four lads from Liverpool, for a comic meant to introduce the BEATLES, who would be here in the United States in a couple of months. The book was the Dell Giant Beatles 64 page comic. 
Joe has also produced art for many commercial ads, Record album covers, and logos, through the years as well of some very popular products. During his nearly sixty years as a Marvel freelancer and then salaried artist working from home, Sinnott inked virtually every major title, with notable runs on The Avengers, The Defenders and The Mighty Thor. 
Marvel impresario Stan Lee in the mid-2000s cited Sinnott as the company's most in-demand inker, saying jocularly, "Pencilers used to hurl all sorts of dire threats at me if I didn't make certain that Joe, and only Joe, inked their pages. I knew I couldn't satisfy everyone and I had to save the very most important strips for him. To most pencilers, having Joe Sinnott ink their artwork was tantamount to grabbing the brass ring".

Aaron Moore - Writer
Jordon Johnson - Artist
For Mature Audiences (Extreme Graphic Violence / Language / Adult Situations)
72 pages
Black & White
Trade Paperback format
Part 1 of 3
Based on the true story of an idea I had. Instead of a short answer to the question, "What if zombies attacked?" I decided to write a "hypothetical autobiography" of having to deal with a zombie attack and recalling the events that took place. I have laid out the frames in a "real-time" format, there is no break in the action once it starts. I am very excited to have such a talented artist doing the pages, Jordan Johnson. His inking style is exactly what I had in mind for the Black&White Horror look.
 Good Question, but it is not really "right now" I started this story almost 10 years ago. I have been writing 3 "If..." stories about: Zombies, Winning the Lotto and having Super-Powers. Each story has it's own universe and style, the only connection is that I'm writing them. Also with each story, I wanted to focus on different genres. Zombies is Dark, Hardcore & Violent. Lotto is a drama/comedy. Super-Powers is a mix of everything.  When bringing up the ideas with artists, they all seem to be interested in drawing zombies. I feel like I have new and interesting twist on Zombies. I hope it to be un-like any Zombie story you have experienced before. With over 200 pages in the series, an epic story unfolds over 3 books. This first book focuses on the main characters, the zombies and helps set some of the "rules" for the story. The book has been broken up, because there are major changes in the story. I am not actually a big fan of zombies and that is a reason why I wrote this. I want to show how shocking yet pointless zombies are... and that humans, as well as other things are much more dangerous.
Over the past couple years going to comic-cons, I have noticed a spike in self published comics and the possibility for Kickstarter to help bring your visions to life. Originally this was supposed to be an animated short, so I found myself in need of artists to draw zombies that I could animate, this was much harder than I thought. Since I was already laying out my Superhero story as a comic, I decided to to make all of them in comic form. For many years it was my goal to turn my artist (painters) friends into comic artists for my books. Real Life, families and jobs made it almost impossible for them to dedicate the time needed for a comic. So after a few years I still had very little to show for everything. Even though I kept writing, the thought of these stories ever getting done was becoming slim. I feel that this is the best (and a quicker) way to get this first book done. I have building and working on this Kickstarter since Oct 2013, I am not rushing anything and making sure everything and everyone is ready and making sure there are some fun rewards ready for you backers!
Probably the most common reason for comics on Kickstarter is to help pay for the Printing of the book, but in addition to this I am asking for help to secure Jordan on this massive project. The writing is finished so my job is pretty much done. My "payment" is getting my story out to the world. We already have a few pages done and he is ready to start pumping out the rest of the pages! We would like to be able to print some copies of the preview and other reward items to have for upcoming comic-cons: Fantasticon (April 12th)
We are not here to make a profit, if fully funded, every extra dollar will go towards starting the art for part 2 of the book.
It is our goal to send the book to print by Late August/Early September. This will allow 2-3 days for each page to be finished and ready for print.
Also, if the book is funded and when completed, I will be making a Motion Comic. I will send this as a FREE Thank you Gift to ALL Pledgers! You will get an update on this Kickstarter with link to video when completed. (Please note this side project for me, All pledged funds only go towards finishing the book)
All Rewards will ship with Online Tracking.
